text: Food was OK, tried the BBQ chicken and the brisket.  Both were dry, and the BBQ sauce was average at best.   Only got one biscuit, inspite of  asking for two.    Probably will not be back.

Had never heard of this place until last week.  A friend of mine was bull riding on Friday night, so I decided to check this place out.  It only took me 30 minutes to get there...  but, this place felt like world's away!!!    Country-type of atmosphere.  Cowboy hats and boots were abundant!  And the place is really big.  You can do a $10 food buffet outside or go into the back, sit down, eat, drink, and listen to some tunes.  And if you're brave, you can even get up and dance!  Also, every Friday night is bull riding.  This was, by far, my favorite part of the evening.  There were 3 rounds.  My friend rode on the 1st bull in the 1st round.  They randomly select which person will ride which bull.  Some people can't stay on, but others stayed on for the full 8 seconds.  It was really neat to watch!    I would highly recommend this place.  Especially if you need to get away from the hustle, bustle, and craziness of the city.
I agree device is terrible food worse. This is all show but the show is not worth it. A tourist trap. Worst meal we had in a week at Care Free. Too many goog places for barbecue avoid this one.

My friends took me to Buffalo Chip for the first time last night and what an amazing night it was! The bartenders are great, I love that they have dancing and live music, and it was fun to watch the bull riding. It would be rough during the summer that they do so much outside but since they just finished restoring the inside, I don't know if everything being outside is normal or they just haven't moved it back in yet. During the fall though, it's perfect.  I had the pulled pork sandwich and it was fantastic. I'm not a huge BBQ fan but I will order that again and again. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they have the Smirnoff Coolers.   I didn't give it 5 stars because our waitress was a bit slow. I know that it was busy but she couldn't remember our drink orders very well. We preferred to go the drinks from the bar ourselves. The drinks were a bit on the pricey side but other than that, I very much enjoyed my time there.   Someone who I think is the manager stopped by a few times to see how we were doing, but he never introduced himself so I don't know for sure.

Took a colleague who is from China to experience something a bit different. The atmosphere was unique. The waitress was very prompt and helpful. However, the barbecue (brisket, pulled pork) was subpar - very dry, over cooked. Far from the best barbecue...

My favorite place to go out in Cave Creek, hands down. Not only is this a staple for those of us who live here, but a great place for those visiting to get a taste of Arizona Cowboy nightlife. This is a BBQ joint through and through, with my personal favorite being the Beef Brisket Sandwich. The meat itself is always cooked perfectly and the portions are generous. For a fun dessert, try the smores you get to cook right at your table! Whether you're going for Bull riding on Friday nights or to listen to Pat James, you're guaranteed to have a fun night.
Neat when first walk in.  Then tables are terribly uncomfortable, menu is puny.  Food is average at best.  Too many other really good places!

Are you a cowboy? A cowgirl? A honky-tonker? A wanna be? Or just a person who loves one-off places? Then this is the place for you. This place is legit and right out of a tombstone movie. At any minute you feel like a duel could start or a bucking bronco could come through the door. Besides that, the food and drink are great and the clientele is amazing (read:real cow pokes). Do it, you know you want to.

We visited the Buffalo Chip this past Friday night with our two teenage children and it was a very fun experience.  The bull riding was exciting to watch, the food was good and served quickly and the band was amazing. It is open air which my family really enjoys but you may have to deal with a few bugs as a result. As it is a saloon, the atmosphere is loud and crowded, so if you are looking for a quiet sit down meal, this isn't the place, but if you want a real taste of the southwest, I highly recommend it.

Live bull riding, fire pits and outdoors bars?! What a great venue! Dress for the weather and head out to see the live bull riding. From the patriotic opening ceremony to live action riding and no cover. Yep, go check it out!
The pulled pork & brisket are awesome! Great, tentative staff, delicious food & the bull riding on Friday is fun to watch! We will go back!

buffalo chip is awesome.  the bull riding is the real deal and you can expect to see some very tough, young cowboys beaten up a bit by the bulls.  there's a country band and dancing inside, a few bars, bonfires, fish fry and barbecue-everything a person needs for an authentic cowboy experience.  it's very family friendly.

Great place for a group of friends to watch the Friday night bull riding....but please note that you have to be 21+ to enter unless you have a parent (even if you're 20 years old)! It doesn't matter whether you plan on drinking or not, but they are STRICT about letter underagers in. Not to mention I was ID'd at the entrance, when I ordered a drink, and again just walking around with a drink in my hand.  Good fun for those that are 21+, just don't invite your underage friends...they'll have to go home!

This place is an absolute dump, with the worst type of people operate this pile of shit. The owner told me to fuck off, after my kid fell from a a faulty high chair they provided. If you are white trash this is your place!

We have been here many times but sad to say will NEVER eat here again. The food has gone from good to average to awful.  Fried chicken was very over cooked and greasy-the Fried chicken used to be amazing here. The brisket sandwich was the size of a slider all food was served at room temp. Both the mens and ladies restrooms were had toilets overflowing no soap or towels. Where do the employees wash their hands? They used to have JJohns out back to help with the large number of people on Friday night to watch the bull riding. They are now gone and far too many people for the restrooms to handle in a sanitary manner.  Will eat at Harold's first from now on!

Typical cowboy joint...loud music, sawdust floors, hanging boots from ceiling. Parking was tight. Waitress was quick in refilling drinks, but long time for the meal. Two of our party was served 40 mins after order taken, the rest of us did not get our meals for another 20 mins. Food was average, French fries were cold. Well not be returning soon.

Wanted to go back and do lunch to see the place after reopening after their fire last November. Yes it was lunch time and they were busy but we had three waitresses look at us as as the table had not Been cleared and quickly walked away. Never saying they would be right with us or anything. Other tables with people also not being acknowledged. We waited about 15 minutes and decided to leave and went across the parking lot to Harolds. No excuse for bad service. Reopening not brand new and with tongue in cheek I say this wasn't their first rodeo. Won't be going back.

Baby back ribs were tough and chewy. Yech!!! Beans had no flavor.  My wife had pulled pork that was horrible. Had to spend $35 to find out this place is a dump. Had to buy another lunch down the road at Dairy Queen.

I recently visited Arizona for the first time and I visited the Buffalo Chip almost every day I was there. It's certainly the place to go for a good time. They have a good beer selection, my favorite being the Sculpin. The waitresses were very accommodating, the bartenders were friendly, and the managers really go the extra mile to put a smile on a customer's face. Can't wait to go back to Cave Creek and see all my new friends at the Chip!

This is a WI-FI Review        When at a restaurant, coffee shop or other business,  I, like many other people these days want internet access  using my IPod or IPhone through a free WI-FI connection.        The Buffalo Chip Saloon does have WI-FI but it is marginal at best. If you are sitting at the bar inside "The Shack In the Back" which is part of the outside patio, the connection is pretty good. Twenty feet away, at the outside bar, the connection comes and goes - mostly goes, and forget about sitting at any of the tables.        I'm not even sure if the WI-FI here is intended for public use, it's locked and requires a password to connect. I asked an employee and they did give me the password. Overall the bottom line here is the system could use some work - maybe an additional access point to cover the outside area. Additionally it would be nice not to have to enter a password. Too bad about the WI-FI because this is one of my favorite places in Cave Creek. 2 stars for The Buffalo Chip Saloon on their WI-FI.                                          Food and Drink        They have 22 oz. cold Amber Boch beer and buckets of free salted in the shell peanuts, a definite plus!

I have been to the Chip on many occasions and always have a great time. The atmosphere is so much fun! They always have pretty great service. One particular time the service was absolutely amazing. I made sure to catch our servers name.. Elizabeth. It was a fairly busy evening and she was on top of her game, never forgot about us. She was extremely reliable.. Anytime we needed anything, there she was! She was also very sweet and seemed like she genuinely cared about giving great service. I would be happy to have her as my server anytime!

Friday night is a nightmare. The arrangement at the new building is long tables in rows too close to each other. When someone gets out to the dance floor or to the bar or wherever, all have to get up and squeeze to let them pass through. Very annoying. We used to go to Buffalo Chip a lot before it burnt down. No more. Not worth it. Luckily there is more competition now.
can not wait for the grand reopening. miss the place!!!!! the fire was horrible!!!

This place is fun on Friday nights for watching the bull riding but the restaurant is just terrible.  It was so packed people couldn't move inside.  There were 2 lanes of people trying to get in and out.  The line for the women's bathroom wrapped all the way around the inside of the restaurant and the toilets weren't working properly.  The food is ok and not expensive but the service is some of the worst I've experienced.  The waitresses wander around aimlessly with seemingly no assigned tables.  You have to flag them down to get any kind of service and they'll sometimes look directly at you and keep walking.    What should have been a quick meal turned into an hour long exercise in frustration that included mediocre food and excessively loud music.  Bottom line, don't bother.  Go across the parking lot to Harold's.  There's still live music, the service is much better, food is comparable, it's less crowded and easier to move around.  I won't be going back to Buffalo Chip.  As its name implies, it's shit.

Went looking for Mexican food in Cave Creek and stumbled upon Buffalo Chip.  Great country feeling bar, peanuts on the floor.  Being Christmas night service was a little slow, but free two step lessons and nice country cover band.  I had the Brisket, had EXCELLENT cowboy beans and the best biscuit with honey poured over the top.  For dessert try the Smoors at your table.  Friday night they have Bull Riding and an old fashion covered wagon cookout.

This must have changed owners from the last time that we visited.  You now have to pay for refills for sodas and there was a hair in my food.  The waitress said that the manager was kind of mean so he wasn't going to discount our meal even though I couldn't eat it.

Took the family here for the bullriding! It was very fun! It had a very cool cowboy set up! I've lived in this area for awhile and never been here. Food was alright bartender was on the snotty side. I will come back for the entertainment

Fun place, friendly people as well. Great service, we weren't sure we would make it by the time they stopped serving dinner so we called, the guy on the phone let us put in an order so we wouldn't miss out. I like that kind of friendly service

Bull riding Friday nights!  Heck yeah!    Definitely a good time.  Bon fires and beers and men in tight jeans.  Cant beat it.  There's usually a band playing inside too, it's so cute watching older couples two-step together.  Aww...  Bathrooms are a bit rough though.  Try and hold it...

Very disappointed. Had a reservation for 40 people and they didn't have a space for us and stuck us in the back corner. Once they sat us 30 mins later the service was okay and the food which is buffet style took 45 mins for burgers and fries. The BBQ was good. Very busy and they weren't ready for the crowds. Would of had a better burger at In n Out.
It still has the feel of the old buffalo chip which I love! Good food! cold beer! Great place go watch a packers game! Great stafff

Atmosphere is fun - especially for out of town guests. Friday night bull riding was a riot. Definitely DO NOT eat here.  For $15 it is all you can eat FAT rinds. My slice of beef had literally no beef. One guy trying to carve chicken, sausage, beef and doll out pulled pork by himself as the line wrapped around the coral. Want refills?  Stand in line again!  One waiter told me I didn't need to stand in line but to go up and butt in front of people who were in line waiting. No set rules on this feed and I couldn't see fighting my way t get another piece of gristle. One out of town guest was so turned off after first bite he couldn't continue to eat.  Nice enough people - just go for the drinks and bull riding but don't bother with the food. YUK!!

Beers & Bull riding = Great!  Service & Management = Poor!  After waiting 2 hours for our food- the order was completely wrong AND our bimbo server Sherri forgot a meal!  By this time, the band started at 8pm.  We were the ONLY table left in the middle of the dance floor with cowboys two-stepping around us!  Sherri asked our table of 10 (including our pregnant sister) to move to another table.  This table didn't exist! We stood around, being pushed and shoved, while asking to see the Manager Mark - who conveniently avoided our group. They finally threw a picnic table cloth over a pool table and posted us up there.  Mark "made up" for the chaos by buying us a round of drinks??!!  Cheers  to you Mark.  You just lost our business!   Bottom line: Ask for ANY other server than Sherri, make sure you don't get seated on the dance floor anywhere after 6pm AND for large group dinners-- this is NOT the place to go.  I'd like to throw Mark & Sherri in the Bull Rink and make them both Rodeo Clowns for the night!

Came here on a whim to get out of the house and picked it based on reviews.  Don't come for lunch and expect anything but 10 items to choose from on the menu.  Bbq plate was ok, fatty brisket and a strong vinegar based sauce.  Beans were bleh and breaded mushrooms were frozen. Waitress was very nice though.  We will go to Harolds next time

This was mine and my wife's first time here we loved the atmosphere and the live music was great. But when it came to the food I was extremely unimpressed my wife had the beer but chicken that she wouldn't even eat it was so dry and rubbery and I had the 3/4 pound ribeye for $20 it came out extremely thin not saying it was not the right size but it was on the slim side I ordered it at med rare it was a good med we'll. and on the services to start I asked her for my stake to be cooked Pittsburg style she looked at me and said this isn't a stake house. At the end she brought our bill we were with two others she had all the items on the wrong checks and even on both we tolled her what was wrong so she could fix it no big deal we'll she did not fix it and ran the card anyways so that took us another 35 min to get it all fixed. I gave two stars for the environment and a food time. I may go back but not for food!!!

I don't know what happened to the guy that was doing the BBQ, but the new cook doesn't know what BBQ is. It is horrible now, we won't be back for the buffet if this new cook is there. No flavor and tough. Very disappointed, too bad we were planning on having a party there but not now.

I would like to break up my review into two parts. First, the food- it is not good.  With the exception of the Onion Rings- everything else was less than mediocre.  Within our group we tried the pork sandwich, rib eye, a salad and the fish fry.  I definitely do not recommend this place for the food.  (although we did eat outside and on this particular evening there was an outside buffet which may have been better).  Second- the bull riding on Friday nights- great fun and very entertaining!  These bull riders were the real deal and the crowd and ambience was great.  Big bonfires, drinks, bleachers, etc.  Next time I will definitely eat dinner somewhere else and then head over to BC for the bull riding and drinks only.

This was just a bad night. Food was good. Waiter was friendly. Service was astonishingly horrible. Food came out haphazardly if at all. Some of us  didn't get our food at all. Granted it just reopened. They may have employment issues but truly the worse service imaginable.

It would be really hard to find a more authentic western saloon (it is so western that it would be silly to call it a "bar"). Not only is it a great place to hang out, drink, eat, and dance to live (country) music but on Wednesdays and Fridays they have actual bull riding competitions (and I am not talking about mechanical bulls but real, live, mean bulls). And to top it all off, the drinks are pretty cheap.

If you're into country music and and dancing this place is ideal. Drinks aren't very cheap but it's very homey and hard to feel out of place. On Friday nights there is live bull riding, bonfires and BBQ. Not much more you can ask for in my opinion. Being from Tempe it's a little out of my way but well worth it!
Tried the smoked brisket. better than what it use to be (#excellent). Atmosphere was family friendly and the bull riding was very entertaining.
The place is awesome!....the atmosphere, service, entertainment and food. You can go inside to dance and get cooled off or enjoy the live bull riding and entertainment outdoors.

Staff is indifferent. We were left standing at door wondering if we should seat ourselves, which we did given that we were completely ignored and they were not even busy. Nachos for 4? NOT! NOTHING like they were before fire..... Staff doesn't have answers for anything. they basically shrug and walk away- no personality, at all. Service slow slow slow. Will NOT be back.

Great atmosphere! Country music, decor and dance floor, although it all could use a good dusting. Waitress was so cute and helpful. My highlight... I am from WI, 16 years in Green Bay, so pulling up to Packer flags waving a huge "Packer Fans Welcome" banner and fried cheese curds and brat bites on the menu! Heaven! I've had better barbeque, but it really didn't matter!  I'd love to be there this Sunday for the playoff game! Go Pack and go to Buffalo Chip Saloon!!

The bull riding is great on Wed and Friday nights! Bartenders are great and work so hard especially on game days. Food is ok. Nothing to brag about. Cheese curds are good and very much like Wisco taste and texture. Brats are not like Wisco at all and was not a fan but maybe it's different out here in the wild west. All you can eat bbq could use some work. Wasn't all that great. Meat was fatty and lots of bones. I have a great time here and the atmosphere is fun. Now here is the issue...  Organization for the events needs to be better. I made reservations 3 weekends in a row. All the reservations were messed up. I called several times each week starting early in the week to confirm my seats and never got a call back. The first time I got there and was put in the vip room which was fine. I got there at 1130, got seated and then went down to the bar with my family. Came back up to vip room about 2 right before the game and people were in our seats. Which is fine but we nicely asked them to move and they claimed they were given those seats. So we moved down Cuz they were starting to cause a scene and I didn't want to fight and ruin the day. Had somebody just told us hey we moved to u guys down a few seats then it would have been avoided and no awkwardness at the table. Anyway we got over that..made reservations for the next two weekends and again no call back to confirm. We showed up and we had asked for Bar seats in front of a TV and they didn't have our reservation. Alright. Frustrating.  They did squeeze us in at the bar but we had to stand for 30 minutes before they made 2 people move from the spots even tho we made reservations.  Several other people had problems with their reservations as well. I hate to complain too much Cuz in the end it was fun, the Bartenders and atmosphere are great. The even organization needs a lot of work though. The tent set up this last weekend was also a disaster. One TV, not enough wait staff. People kept coming in from the tent to order at the bar and hovering over myself and others, spilling their drinks all over us. Hopefully next packer season and future events will be planned Better. Jackie is a nice girl but maybe needs more help with reservations and a better system for keeping track of reservations and phone numbers.

Man oh man, this place is great. Not just for the delicious BBQ and other food, but for the actual establishment (sawdust on floor, line dancing, pool tables, ARM WRESTLING machine and BULL riding!) and the people. April was super nice and Bob the pit master is the greatest. See, we're into BBQ and he spent a lot of time with us - totally by chance, just came up to us and started talking. Showed us around his pits and even gave us tips for our home smoking! We genuinely had a great time and will definitely come back next time we get out west. Worth the trip you'll be glad you went.
Great local fare. Reasonable prices. I had the fish tacos, a surprising tasty meal for a cowboy saloon. The slaw recipe on top of the fish was wonderful. I would choose this again.

Food is the worst in Cave Creek. Should have eaten at the gas station counter. It was the first and last time we will go.  Actually signed up for Yelp just to review this trash heap of restaurant .  Took some friends from out of town,they had steak. Both steaks were raw, even though one was ordered medium well. sent both back, waited another 30min then they came out cold. I ordered the ribs that the waitress said were great, slow cooked and fall off the bone. These tasted like overcooked pork chops whose bones my two dogs would not even be able to clean.  Tonight I purchased ribs at the local grocery store they were MUCH better and reminded me to post this review.  Never go to this place...  The drinks were not even good. Want beer and country music? Turn on the radio, go to the gas station buy a COLD 12 Pack (yeah the beer in plastic cups was warm)

The service is incredibly slow.  We have been sitting here for over 45 minutes and still no food.  At this point, I really don't care how good the food is, I'm so irritated that I don't want to eat it.  There is zero chance that I will ever come here.

I understand that this place is bar food but this place is amazingly bad. The food is the definition of bad. We were there on a Friday. There were eight of us and had a variety of food. 100% of it was consistently bad. Not just bad but really, really bad. If you go there, skip the food!  Just have a beer and definitely don't waste your money on the stuff they call food.

Wednesday night and you're looking for some fun?  Check out the live bull riding and cowboy buffet with live music later on indoors & s'mores.    Be quick about deciding exactly *which* meats you want though or they will pile up your plate with ALL OF THEM!!!  (I had meals for a couple of days...)    You sit on wooden bleachers to watch the bull riding from a few feet away from the ring.  Wow!  Haven't ever been that close to bull riding before!  Kind of makes me want to do the running of the bulls in Cave Creek in mid-October.  Had so much fun here, I really did!  I wasn't sure what to think before I went but had such fun I will definitely go back!  Tip:  Don't wear white pants and you'd probably better leave your stilettos at home.  It is pretty darned casual here.
Used to go to this place back when the smoking laws weren't in effect. It was very dark and you always left smelling like smoke. Now it is so much better! Good food and good times!

If you go to Cave Creek you must go to the Buffalo Chip, Harold's , hideaway etc.  just great local restaurants in a great town north of Phoenix/Scottsdale.   I like the Chip more for drinking dancing and rodeo than the food. But it is okay for a little grub   But it is fun.  So try it

I will never go back. We called and made reservations and were asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside. We picked outside...and they neglected to tell us you cannot order a steak dinner...which they are supposedly known for, if you sit outside. That would have been nice too know.

I went here on a Wednesday to watch a good friend ride a bull on amateur bull riding night. The atmosphere was really cool with campfires and the old times bar. Waitstaff was really friendly and even had drink service in the grand stands. I did not eat so I cannot comment on the food. Overall if you want a cool place to grab a drink with free entertainment this is a great place!!!

I've been enjoying the Buffalo Chip since 1995.  I took out of town friends there on Saturday April 1, 2017 and ordered 5 glasses of cabernet at $7 per glass,  tipping the waiter $5 cash.  My receipt said $7 each glass, but the Buffalo Chip charged my card $60 - for 5 glasses of cabernet ($12 for each $7 glass of cabernet - the charge on the receipt was $35).  I saw another reviewer on a Google site, who referenced "greedy Larry" (the alleged owner).  Well Larry, this is fraud - collecting an extra $25 for your bank account is illegal.  I intend on reporting the Buffalo Chip for their deceptive business practices. Larry shame on you for defrauding our winter visitors, along with the good citizens who live in the area. We don't need greedy, dishonest people running businesses in Cave Creek.  I won't be back and I will so advise everyone I know.  Word of mouth is powerful, as is Karma.

Had a blast on Friday night bull riding with my 13 year old son.  Spring for the VIP seats (call in advance to make a reservation).  Best $10 per person spent in a long time.  The food is acceptable - I wouldn't come just for the food - but still gets a 5 star from me because such great value and atmosphere.

First I think the more positive reviews are based on a bar and bull riding place and not so much the food and service. The good - the chuck burger was good. The bad - the Friday night fish fry is a definite pass. Dry fish and quite tasteless.  The choice sirloin was raw to rare when she ordered medium. Not seasoned at all. The Cowboys beans that came with it were good. The ugly - 30 minutes from being seated to waitress at the table. 40 minutes for water. The food was up 20 minutes after ordering. So an basically a hour to get food. Wife asked about the different kinds of fish and the server said, "I don't know I don't eat fish!"  Obviously no service training. A waiter should always know their menu regardless. If you are in a party mood then come for the fun and beer. Skip the food.

Went in there with my wife today. Got 4 cans of  beer for $10. Not a bad deal. I ordered 3 shots of fireball. Came out in three thimbles, figured about an ounce and a half total for all 3. $21, you kidding me. That should be criminal. Could have bought a bottle of fireball for that.

Worst breakfast service and worst breakfast food we've ever had.  We will probably never be back, fun place to dance and drink on a Friday night but horrible for a Sunday when you are starving and waiting an hour for food. Nothing was cooked to order... Yuck!

Our friends in the South Valley didn't believe us when we told them there was a place close to our house to see live Bull riding on a Friday night. This is an experience that is worth taking a little drive. Cave Creek is cute as and the Buffalo Chip fits into the whole down home vibe of the place. We have been here during bike week and it is biker heaven. The crowd is happy and friendly - great for people watchers. The day we went they had a decent live band and people where dancing on the outdoor dance floor with the "ghost town" facade in the background. Friday nights (and Wednesdays) they have live Bull riding and all you can eat BBQ for $10. The food was good and the service was great. The owner personally took care of us and could not have been nicer. They lit a huge fire outside and it was truly magical to sit outside with a cold one, some BBQ and live cowboy entertainment. Perfect for kids...better for them than sitting at home playing video games!

There were 14 of us ranging from 60+ to 5. We loved the atmosphere. We all loved the food as well. We all ordered something different including appetizers and it was all delicious. I am from Georgia as are 8 of the other guests. We are here visiting family and they suggested we all go. We will definitely come back our next trip out West.

Love this place. Recently enjoyed some bull riding action (watching of course) but the entire time it was SO dusty, it was a huge disappointment. And I'm not talking about just the bull riding- I mean, just the people walking around - it was super super dusty. Not cool. Otherwise looking forward to some fun nights with the great weather and their reopening!

We had a great time on new year's eve. We enjoyed the band inside AND the bond fires and music outside. The staff was warm and friendly. The crowd was fun. It was a perfect night. Can't rate the food as we ate before arriving to party. Go there to get your cowboy and cowgirl fun on!

Beyond fabulous atmosphere and character at this great Creeker bar. The food is pretty good, especially the wings and the pulled pork. The star are all super-friendly and the bullring  is a real crowd-pleaser on Wednesdays and Fridays. I love their bloody mary breakfast at the weekend. Fire pits, smores and cowboys, what's not to love!

One of the big draws for us to hit up Buffalo Chip was that they offered free Western dance lessons! After we stuffed ourselves with Southern Fried chicken and half a rack of ribs, we sipped on some Apple Pie moonshine cocktails while the place slowly started to fill up.  I was honestly surprised at the number of regulars that showed up (dressed to the nines in their Western gear!), ready to dance the night away! We were taught the Western waltz, and it was so much fun since we had to switch up partners throughout the night and socialize.  The live band was a great and it was really fun to try something out of our norm.

Had dinner at the Buffalo Chip on a Monday Night.  The restaurant was hosting a Christmas party for their employees.  Our group ordered 5 meals.  The two Brisket sandwiches ordered were dry, and not very flavorful.  The two Pulled pork sandwiches were almost as bad.  For the $100 spent on dinner and soft drinks we could have eaten better food for far less somewhere else.  Don't bother going here for the food, the only reason to go here is for the bull riding and bottled beer

MAKE RESERVATIONS! The atmosphere was great - sawdust on the ground added to the ambiance! Green Bay Packer & WI Badger games televised live here! We had the "buffet" - 1lb of food for $10.97. Included in your pound are your sides (biscuit, beans, corn) & meat (chicken, rib tips, brisket, pulled pork) My pound included almost 1/4lb of fat and bones - brought this to the attention of our waitress (April) and her fix was to tell them next time that I don't want so much fat and bones. SUGGESTION: make reservations for 5ish & then watch bull riding on either Wednesday or Friday.  We wanted to do this but didn't eat til almost 7 - by the time we got out it was winding down - there are 2 sessions though. Fun for entire family - something different to do! Live country bands and dancing.
Very authentic cowboy bar, with outdoor fire pit, music and bulls riding show on Wednesday and Fridays.

This place is so fun!  Food is great. Especially the beef brisket, which can be ordered by the pound!  If you're in to clean floors and matching chairs, then avoid this place. If you're into fun places with great service and amazing food with an old ranch feel, this place is second to none.  Also, this is a very Packer friendly bar. All Green Bay games are shown here. Check it out!!!

Look, it is what it is.  BCSS or Beer Can Chicken as we call it in our house is a Western Throwback where you can go for line dancing, bull riding watching, reasonably priced drinks, and decent food.  Overall this is a place you'll go once a year with friends from out of town to show them what Cave Creek is all about.  The nachos are huge and meant for sharing.  The ribs are "ok" but no where near as good as Bryan's down the road.  I would recommend the burgers as a safe bet.

After receiving horrible (lack of) service from a competitor across the street and a little to the east, we made our way to the Buffalo Chip where we were greeted well and received excellent service.  The Buffalo Chip was friendly and had an enjoyable atmosphere, cold beers and good food.  Our server checked in with us routinely and was a huge part of our magnificent time there!  Heading back soon!
Terrible food and terrible service,  obviously the place orders cheap food and tries to  serve it as good bbq.   TOURIST TRAP.!!!  Go for drinks,  dance and bullriding,  stay away from the food.

I will give four stars mostly for the entertainment the rodeo shows are fun to watch!  The food on the other hand, not so great.  My husband had the ribs which were very very fatty I did not care for them at all I took one bite and could not continue.    My daughter had the chicken wings plain which had a very strange chickeny flavor to it again I could not take another bite and stopped.  My daughter ordered the sirloin steak and she also said it was not very good.  I had the iceberg salad with blue cheese dressing which was OK and jalapeño poppers which how can you go wrong with that.  So basically four stars for the entertainment but one star for the food.

Came in for dinner Friday (3/16) with reservations for a party of 8. Needless to say we had the worst experience with the manager and getting sat. The nice hostess (young/blonde) was seating us when another host sat our table at the same time. Things happen. I get it. But this turned into an hour long mess trying to get a table. Tara our server was very accommodating and is the only reason I'm not giving a worse star. You guys are lucky to have her and she is the reason one day I hope to return and give Buffalo Chip another try.

As soon I walked in the door, I was in honky-tonk heaven.  This is a real country bar with great live country music, well sized dance floor for 2-stepping, indoor & outdoor bars, great crowd that is a mix of bikers, cowboys, and locals both young and old just looking to have a good time, and of course the live bull-riding. Yes, anyone with $40 bucks and a death wish can sign a waiver and ride a live bull (Wednesday evenings) For those of us less-adventureous folks, we can watch from the bleachers. Top that off with food sold for $10.00 a pound, and you got yourself one heck of a good time Y'all!   Tip -It's a bit of a drive to get here, as the saloon is located in the city of Cave Creek, so make sure you assign a designated driver.

This is a really unique fun place to go! Bullriding, outdoor bar, Country music and the best fried chicken I have had in.. well.. I can't remember when I have had better. Oh and affordable even with the Uber taxi home!

This is a great venue, beer is cold, but the food is basically garbage!  I've personally spoken to the owner about with such a great venue, why doesn't he improve the food.  His attitude was why should I, look at all the business I've got with what I'm serving.  I no longer waste my money on any menu items here; just drink the cold beer!

Cave Creek and the Buffalo Chip Saloon are a bit of Wild West in Arizona. On the Wednesday night in March that we arrived the place was surrounded with pickup trucks, jeeps, and real and wanna-be cowboys. There was a long, very slowly moving line waiting at the outside buffet. You choose your meat (they give you a pound of it!) and some sides. And of course there is cold beer. We chose to go inside and grab something. It was busy, but far quicker than the patio buffet, although it was confusing to even find our way to the restaurant. The place is kind of a maze.   Once inside, we ordered beers - very cold!  That was nice. Fast service. Sat at the bar. Ordered the homemade fried chicken and a burger. Both were good, but the chicken was better. Definitely homemade.  However, if you're looking for a neat, organized, well appointed atmosphere you won't find it at the chips. It more resembles a cowboy mess hall and its a bit messy, loud, and crazy. But it was packed - and that says something.   After dinner we headed back outside for the Wednesday night entertainment of amateur bull riding...and we're not talking mechanical bulls...these are the real bucking, snorting, and kicking big boys. The bleacher seating around the arena was packed, there were bonfires roaring, and the crowd was wound up and having a great time. This is a highlight of the Chip.  Would we go back?  Maybe not.  But we're glad we went once. It was a fun experience.  If your near Cave Creek, you should do the same.
Saturdays is really slow, but the staff are always fun and friendly. But over all it's a nice change.

This place is so fun!! I'm glad you guys decided to re-build. When we walked in the manager, Scott, greeted us and that made it feel all the more personal. Bull riding was great! Definitely a place you want to check out. After that we moved to the outside bar area where Dustin helped us. He was so professional and helpful we assumed he was a manager!! This guy is a keeper for sure! Good job on hiring him! The only thing I'm bummed about is that I didn't win the PBR tickets! Overall great experience and we will definitely be back!! :)
I just love this place! The genuine western ambience is outstanding. We always take visitors from Europe here and they all LOVE it! The bull riding just tops off the evening!!
Tried to give my business to the small town. Lights were equivalent to a tanning booth. LED Lights do come in many different wattages. Tvs were way too high up.  Thought I was in old country buffet.

I'm 90% sure the owner of this burned it down rather than doing the right thing and selling it or closing it and now he isn't giving his employees money that was raised for them to get them through the holidays. This guy is a total sleeze ball!

The food is decent and I usually just go for the fish fry on Friday nights because it's all you can eat. The service is a whole other story, servers tend to be rude, forgetful and they will literally come up behind you and scream to communicate. I understand it's usually a packed house and really loud but Jesus, warn someone or make your presence known before howling out orders. I have a huge issue with the forgetfulness of the wait staff as you sometimes have to ask two or three times to get what you want, no matter how busy they are, this shouldn't be an issue. I absolutely love the atmosphere and bull riding, it's a great place to go grab a drink and either sit inside and listen to the live band or outside around the bull riding and campfire. And if you get a chance to sit and watch people dance over a beer or five, do that too!

Most of the food is pretty good but we had to stop going to BC a couple years ago because of some of the ridiculous things they do. They stopped sell salad to the patrons on the back porch area when you order food...The bar bill was never consistent on back porch area and some of our friends also felt like they were getting gouged.... Oh you need a drink of water...$2 a bottle. We were invited to thanks giving buffet (as many places do that). We had out of town gusts and asked if we could bring them, but they were refused anyway. How embarrassing! That was really lame and I never go there anymore because of it.   There are many other places we can go in Scottsdale where they appreciate humanoids. I take my money where customer's are treated well.
The Chip is my absolute favorite hometown bar. I will always be a loyal fan. Great food, atmosphere, music, drinks, service and entertainment!
Good food you get way more than you would expect. And bull riding! Always a fun time!

This place is fantastic! A taste of Texas without the drive. Cold beer. Good BBQ. And a rodeo. Hell yea! Barmaids are cute and friendly. This is the real deal. If you don't like it ruff and tumble stay home.

Awesome saloon! Went to this place for a after work get together! I may have used coupons to get my food and beer although it did not take away my bull riding experience! Watched YouTube videos for a few days on how to ride a bull but nothing can prepare you for this Beastly Bohemeth! I paid $40 and signed my life away and got to ride the Bull! I figured how many opportunities am I going to get riding a bull!?!? Awesome staff and supportive staff and bull fighters!

Great place to spend a Friday evening.  We had gone for lunch before a trail ride at Spurs Cross (awesome place!) and the ads for bull riding and dancing intrigued so we went back.  Was well worth it..  Very crowded but kid friendly and inviting.  Band was playing, people dancing and mingling in and out, bull riding as well.  Wish we had places like this in San Diego..

I have been in AZ for almost 1 year. I have been out a few weekends each month searching for fun different places to hang out. Up until going to Buffalo Chip, everywhere I had been was just decent. I absolutely LOVE Buffalo Chip. I was a little skeptical at first about going because I am not a huge country music fan.... but this place was a blast. The food is decent, the drinks are pretty good (and affordable), the patrons are super nice, and the buffalo riding event is FUN. They have fire pits outside near the buffalo riding area to keep you warm... they have bars outside and inside. Inside they have a live band playing music and people are actually up and dancing. After being there I really do want to learn how to country line dance and 2 step. haha. I went with 2 other girls.... and all 3 of us cant wait to go back. Buffalo Chip will most likely be my new "hot spot". Next time I go I will be better prepared... and I will wear a jacket and warmer shoes. I didint realize that we were going to be outside for most of the night. I figured we would watch the bull riding and then go in.... but it was to much fun outside near the firepits to be inside. If you are considering checking out Buffalo Chip... I say do it. I am an East Coast girl (NJ).... and this place was outstanding.

The food was average at best.  We were told they had a new chef that was famous because she had been on Food Network and we were going to love our burgers, funny.  I was grossed out by how very dusty & dirty everything was.  We went there based on Yelp reviews, we wished we would have tried somewhere else.  Maybe it is just a good bar/hang out place???
Very good .I love this place.great food great atmosphere.fun place for family.they also have alot of fun things they do for kids .

So I live near Cave Creek but have never been to the Buffalo Chip, but have been to many other Cave Creek restaurants. We have friends visit from Chandler, and they wanted to go to the Buffalo Chip, so we agreed.   First the place looks great. I was never there before the fire, but I imagine it looks better now. But the tables are just folding tables and the chairs folding chairs. Not the most comfortable. They need to invest in more permanent digs.   Now on to the food. Between all in the group we ordered many dishes. I ordered the Iceburg Wedge with Blue Cheese and a Fish Taco. The Wedge was $6 and the Fish Taco was $4. Honestly neither was all that good. The taco was quite small and just had a few pieces of fried fish cut into small pieces.  The salad had some blue cheese,  but it seemed like ranch dressing, and store bought certainly. Definitely not worth $6 in my opinion.   My wife had the pulled pork sandwich for $9. Was a normal sized store-bought hamburger bun (unheated) with pulled pork, along with a SMALL amount of baked beans. The baked beans were cold, and the container the beans came in was one of these small containers they usually use for sauce. Tiny.   One other had the catfish, which looked good, but the others weren't happy with their choices. Small portions and average at best. Prices were OK but portions small. We saw several people at other tables that had to order more food because the portions just didn't fill them.  All in all I wouldn't go back  because there are many much better paces in Cave Creek.

All I can say is WOW.  Buffalo Chip hosted the National Concierge Association in the area for its 2013 conference for a night of BBQ and bull riding.  The BBQ buffet was an amazing line up of cowboy fare such as the tastiest biscuits I've ever had, delicious cole slaw and more styles of BBQ than I've seen in one place.    And then there was the entertainment portion of the evening which included a wide range of events such as bull riding for adults and calf and sheep riding for the younger generation.  Despite the heat,  the place was packed with all ages enjoying and supporting the folks risking their lives while trying to conquer the beast.  It was a great night.  Lastly I'd like to recognize Sandy who did a great job serving us and making sure all of our needs were taken care of.  Thanks Buffalo Chip.

Update - We had our wedding rehearsal dinner here - 90% of guests were from "back east"........  To say it was a huge success is an understatement.   Larry the owner / manager is fantastic.   The Buffalo Chip is the real deal and I love it!

Super entertaining bar! My husband and I enjoyed both of our meals and were able to sit for dinner right away. There was also an option to eat BBQ buffet. Enjoyed the bull riding (40 minutes of entertaining bull riders from age 5 to adult). Don't worry, the kids rode calfs.  After the show there was live music, corn hole, Jenga, fire pits for warmth and smores for purchase.  You could also get a pic on a bull. Families brought the entire family. Highly recommended!
Had a blast!  Live music,  live bull riding, great food, great service and great drinks. I love this place & totally worth the drive!

They have a Bbq buffet on Saturdays that's about $11 per person and oh so worth it! The brisket is tender and delicious and the beers are nice and cold!! Check it out if you're ever in Cave Creek. They were named top western bar in Phoenix Times a few times.

Is there ever a time when this place isn't packed?  Answer: I don't think so.  Wow, I have been during the day and during the evening.  This is the most popular place in all of Cave Creek it seems.  Motorcycle clubs, rednecks, pretty women, great food, awesome bands.  Good luck finding a parking space, BTW.  Dirt lot, too.  Big but your car or bike is going to be dust covered.  Try the street tacos - excellent!  The cole slaw is fresh and some of the best I have ever tasted.

Went to their Thursday night dance lessons.    Good music and fun instructor.   Unfortunately this does not carry through to the rest of the place.   Yes, service was decent but beers are a tad pricey.   Food, well you have to remember where you are at, Cave Creek.  It is nothing but lower end bar food for tourist prices.   One would think for what is being paid they would have something tastier to offer.  Seating was uncomfortable and way too close together.  If you were to leave the long table you're sitting at, everyone else will have to stand for you to get out.  If you are looking for some dancing it's fine.  If you are looking for dinner and drinks, there are far better choices in Cave Creek.
I had a great time at the Chip! Hope ya'll do too! Lots of fun, and the food was great. A solid 3.5 stars from me. Gets crowded so go early. Music was terrific.

Went here to meet a friend who happens to be a Green Bay Packer fan. This bar is Lambeau Field West, Cheese Head city. It was a Sunday and the Packers were playing. Every seat in the house was reserved, even the bar stools. Since our friend comes here we got in. We did browse and the place is huge. The outdoor patio is extra large with TV's for viewing, they also have a ring for bull riding. Interesting all around.   The story here is drinks are heavy and good. The patrons are dressed to the T in Green Bay fashion. Plenty of Cheese Heads, Jersey's homemade hats anything and everything. They are ready to party. And party they did when the Packers scored a TD. What The....They jump up and start parading around the bar cheering, singing, DJ playing. Just having the time of their lives. It was fun to watch and this day the Pack scored 53 so it was a hot mess of cheese here.    If you are in cave creek this is a must stop just for the shear amusement. Other bars in the area are dedicated to the Bears, Pittsburgh and the Vikqueens. Have to give it to the fans here, they know how to party. Good times...
Food was ok.  I was hungry, so I'm probably being generous.  The place is cool, if you are into Cowboy bars.  This is a fun place to take out of town guests for a drink.
Great place to come dance and have a good time! Great vibe and people! Last nights live band was AMAZING!!! Can't wait to come back and country western dance!

It's definitely not the old buffalo chip, especially without the shack in the back. I'm a packers fan (while others in my family are Steelers) but this place is awesome during Packer games! The owner Larry Is always there to talk to customers & handle any problems - which is note worthy. Most memorable bartenders to my family & I were Billy, Keleigh, Maggie, & Maddie (not sure if they are still there) but they always seemed to be having fun& cared about their customer experiences! Thank you to the Buffalo Chip!
Great family atmosphere. Live bands, rocking rodeo, great eats and the perfect place to spend a Friday night out!
The food is good and they have great entertainment. Fun place to meet friends. The staff is always friendly and fun. It has the cowboy charm throughout.
Love the chip, did the VIP above the bull riding had a blast thank for the great time

Strange experience here as we attempted to eat lunch here on Saturday. The place was pretty empty with about 3 tables of people dining. The bartender came over and took our drink orders pretty quick, which was two diet cokes. After that, nobody showed up for about 10 minutes, which gave me a chance to read some reviews about the ribs I was about to order and they weren't good. Finally, a waitress showed up and she started telling us about the two fights that took place last night and all the events that go on at the Chip. She also mentioned that the brisket wasn't good which was my backup choice and also some weird explanation of why nobody showed up to take our order (miscommunication with 3 tables full?). Anyway, after all that, we said screw it and decided to bail across the lot to Harold's. Extra star for that bald bartender who gave us our cokes for free and a to-go cup. Otherwise, they were $3 a pop. Might be nice place at night if you like to watch live drunken fights (now, I just watch them on youtube).
Want the Wild West Saloon experience? You got it here! Feel the small town charm of Cave Creek-cowboy food and outdoor chill.

They did a good job of recapturing the old feel of the original Buffalo Chip with the new building, and I commend the owners and staff. Ambiance is great for an old west saloon. We've noticed over the years that if the mesquite grill is going, you will get a great steak, burger, or ribs. Unfortunately, if they are not using the mesqite grill, the food is just okay. This has not changed. You guys have the opportunity to make your food really shine in Cave Creek. You should take advantage of that.
I have never had a bad experience here: from the bull riding to the food and dancing. So. Much. Fun!   Seriously my favorite thing to do when we are in AZ is Friday nights at the Chip!

We are Packers fans and my husband called on Monday to reserve seats for Sunday's game.  -Jackie said she will call back to confirm. No call back and we had to call 3 different times to ensure we had a reservation. Finally we were confirmed after all of our attempts.  -We get there and get seated at the bar (we love sitting at a bar) but we were outside with no heaters and no TV. Um, we are there to watch the game.  -My husband asks Jackie if we can move and she said any two open seats at the bar except for 4 on the left side and two by the restrooms.  -We find seats in the middle of the bar and order drinks. Then the bartender, Billy, tells us that people who have been coming for 20 years want our seats. Then another bartender talks to Jackie about where to move us, and Jackie LIES and says she didn't tell us we could move. WTF? We aren't making it up.  -We are then told we have to move and our option is to go back outside, or we can sit across from each other in the middle of someone else's table. Seriously?  -We decided to leave. Even the bartenders thought it was messed up and gave us our beers for free. That was cool. One star to them.   This place has no organization whatsoever and I still can't believe how poorly we were treated. Too bad, it looks like a cool set up and I heard the food was good.

I've been here dozens of times over the years but for some reason, I've never Yelped it.  Well, since I'm doing the better late than never thing this weekend, I'll do it now.  Popped in here for the annual Red & White Birthday Bash for Sonny B. (still running strong at 73).  Great atmosphere, with a kick ass back patio area.  Grabbed my usual spot and ordered up their oh so refreshing Hefeweizen, in a tall frosty mug.  I also chowed on their burger with fries which also hit the spot.  Caught up with old friends, made some new friends, took a few pics and then Mel and I hit the road for some impromptu green light fun down Scottsdale Road.    Reminded me of the good old days.

The hubs & I recently relocated to Cave Creek (yee haw!) and are lovin' life. This place is the perfect example of why.  A couple of weeks ago my British husband said to me, "I'm gonna have to check the bull riding schedule."  Pardon?  "Put on your cowboy boots."  Well you don't have to tell me twice.  Off we went on a Wednesday night to watch live bull riding and enjoy some cold drinks on the bleachers outside. They have pro and semi-pro riders, but anyone with some balls and the willingness to sign a (very thick) waiver is welcome to give it a whirl. I passed, and advised the hubs that he doesn't have enough life insurance to even begin to consider such an activity. But we sure enjoyed watching everybody else - especially the girl that stayed on longer than her boyfriend - and will absolutely, positively be back for more!  We didn't eat, but the drinks were cold, reasonably priced and delivered quickly by a cordial bartender. Love that it's just a couple of minutes away!

Just have to say damn. That was a lot of fun. The food we got was all about meat. But okay. And got a table, drinks and food  right away even though it was packed.  But the bull riding area out back came as a big surprise.  Will for sure be coming back next time my plans get me to Phoenix.

The service is awful. I was surprised at how rude the people who worked there were. at one point, me and my friends were sitting on the barstools near the bar, and a server who had been cleaning walked past us and said "not the best place to be sitting guys." Well, maybe you shouldn't have barstools there? Similar incidents happened throughout the night. It wasn't that busy, but everyone seemed put out for having to be working. I'm sad we made the drive up there to celebrate my husband's birthday.

One of the awesomest places I've been to yet in Arizona. This is a must for people visiting or newcomers, or it even would be a great place to do a company outing. The food is just okay, but everything else is awesome. Big mugs of beer are only $4 and there is bull riding and cowboy music. The place is totally themed out but I didn't think it was cheesy (or I really liked the cheese).   I wouldn't recommend coming here just for food. For vegetarians there is an all you can eat salad buffet. For meat eaters, there is an endless supply of food you can eat. The biscuits were way too heavy and hard and the cowboy beans are probably an after thought. Their chips and salsa are surprisingly good, and though we didn't order it because we were deep into beer there is a tableside s'mores where you get to roast your own s'mores over an small open flame.  Wear whatever cowboy gear you may have and just come for a good time!
Here for preopening day.  Food was mediocre at best.  No free refills on soda and no beer butt chicken.  Not sure if I'll be back.

It is always scary to plan an event, let alone planning from Seattle and not knowing what you will get.  But... Whitney was AMAZING to work with, made everything I wanted happen and went above and beyond anything I could have imagined.  Our event was for 270 people and EVERYONE loved it.  From Redneck Games to the Rodeo to the most incredible food.  Honey Butter Biscuits, OMG!!  We want to ship those home to us.  Larry is the kindest host and I would recommend Buffalo Chip Saloon to everyone.  After our event, we took it inside and danced until the bar closed.  Thank you for everything and I should ever get back to Arizona, bring on the biscuits.
Come here every Friday and Sunday!  Great place to watch bull riding and roast s'mores. Great for families. Service is a bit slow...otherwise would be 5 stars
Delicious food. Wonderful customer service. Took my family to eat dinner. Their coleslaw was delicious!
Not sure what had changed but the BBQ here is Amazing now. I have never had brisket so delicious! Such a great place! BBQ is definitely a reason to go back and fight the crowd!

This review is focused ONLY on the dining part of the experience.  It looked like plenty of people were having a great time dancing to the live country band, but we were just there for dinner with friends.  Although the servers were friendly, the food was less than desirable.  We ordered the Nacho's (OK), Onion Rings (pretty good), brisket sandwich (not good) and ribs (not good).  The brisket sandwich was laid out on a small bun that looked like the ones you buy at the store for .99 cents.  The worse part was the cheese.  It had the texture of Velveta and just didn't go well with the sandwich.  Our friend, who had ordered the cheeseburger only ate one bite (same issue).  She planned on taking it home and trying to remove the cheese and replacing it with some other kind.  The sauce the ribs were in seemed to be ketchup based.  The ribs themselves underneath the sauce seemed large and meaty but the sauce just destroyed them.  Both my friend and I had ordered the full-rack.  Both of us decided to eat only about 1/4 of them and then take them home, wipe all the sauce off and try our own bbq sauce at home.  The side order of beans were bland and the cole slaw was ok.  We also ordered a wedge salad that was ok.  Overall, if you like country dancing, playing pool, etc. then this place could be fun.  I personally would never eat dinner here again.

I'll update my review since it's been over 5 years.  I love coming here on Friday evenings for the bull riding, great live band, and all around fun atmosphere. Drink prices are spot on (aka cheap). +4 for the atmosphere and fun. Until the new building is ready, be prepared to be outside. But it's really nice outside. Campfires, s'mores, games for the kidos.  Service is pretty good and the employees seem to be enjoying themselves. Because everyone is outside for now, support your wait staff. Sure, you can go stand in line, but the servers really do appreciate you getting your food and drinks through them.  But let's talk about the food: it's just so-so. The BBQ is not bad, but you may end up with a lot of fat. The chicken and pulled pork are your best bets. Bring your own BBQ sauce (we do). It's that bad (just ketchup and something added to it). Slaw is pretty good. Biscuits are good (but they come out of a box). The only good part is the price.  Owners, please read: you are SO CLOSE to being so much better. Improve your food and you won't believe how much better business will be! If you food was better, you would be turning away people Fridays and Saturdays. Just because you have been doing something the same way for years, doesn't mean you can't do better. You can!  The new digs are looking so cool. Can't wait until it opens.

Great experience @The Buffalo Chip.  Great atmosphere and great staff!  Food is good.   Burger could of been more done as well as the chicken sandwich and fries.  What a great place to come to escape from the City hussel and bussel.. : )

We went there at lunch time on a Saturday (yesterday) and it wasn't too busy but  every table had a 'reserved' note on it.  We almost left until another customer came up and explained that 'as long as we were out of there before the time it was reserved it was OK to take a reserved table'.    Service was wicked slow; I think they had two waitresses for the whole place.  Our waitress was nice but was running her butt off to keep up with it all.  It took about an hour for our food to arrive.  We had the nacho mama appetizer which was pretty good but they skimped on the pulled pork.  The steaks were cooked right but were dry as could be and they didn't have steak sauce.  It came with cowboy beans which weren't bad, a bag salad with nasty dressing (not homemade for sure) in a cup the size of a coffee cup, and a biscuit smothered in honey which was pretty good.  The steaks were smoky but otherwise weren't that flavorful (no seasoning, marinade,rub,etc).  I'm sorry but if you're a 'steakhouse' you should at least have your own brand of steak sauce if you're not going to stock A1 or your steak better be so good it doesn't need it! It was OK there but I don't think we'd go back.

Excellent food and service -our server was very knowledgeable.and sassy just the right amount of wit and knowledge. We Decided to forgo the BBQ buffet cause we didn't think we could.do it justice - but the pulled pork sandwich O M G. So good . A welcome stop for a couple of out of towners , great staff, and a definite stop

Really cool place to watch live bull riding! You can even ride the bull if you like. They even have sheep for the kids to ride.   It's also a bar. After 7pm or so they do check ID so make sure you got one. They even give you a bracelet that says they checked your ID. So I went outside(backyard of the bar) to meet my friends they were sitting at a picnic table and they already ordered appetizers from the menu. When we were ready to order the waiter said we can't order from the menu we can have the buffet or we need to move closer to the bar to order from the menu. Totally weird. So we moved & the food was okay. The steak was expensive & they don't give you a lot of food. Definitely recommend eating somewhere else and just come here to watch the bulls.   Come early to get a seat if not you will be standing & wont see much. It was awesome! They even prayed & sang the national anthem like a real rodeo.  They do live bull tidings every Wednesday & Friday nights starting at 8pm.
I alway have fun here! I love the live music, pool tables, bull riding and the overall feel of the place. The food is descent but I prefer to come for the drinks and entertainment.

Husband & I stumbled onto this place on our way back from being a tourist in Sedona. Can't speak for the food but he overall experience of this little cowboy rodeo & dancehall was so much fun. We were there on Wednesday night and the band was AWESOME. We are from Texas so we know a thing or two about live music. We had a blast. We were just bummed we did t have our boots with us.

A fun place to go especially on bull riding nights. Food is fine, not great. My burger the other night was a little charred and overcooked and sweet potatoes could have been hotter. Have had other times where the burger was great so could have been an off night. Server was pleasant but inconsistent.

I can't say that I've tried anything from the menu except Coronas....but, I must say they opened those REALLY WELL! I plan on going back for lunch before I leave town at the end of my winter stay....I'll update my yelpin' at that time! We've gone two Friday nights in a row now for the bull-riding - it's just something I would NEVER otherwise think to go see, but now I'm kinda hooked :) Plus, seeing all those Stetsons, Wranglers, and Tony Lamas put me back in the Country mood that I'd been missing and didn't know it :) There were guests of all ages for the 8:00 bull-riding fun....I'm thinking the crowd changes with the later shows? There was a great band playing some covers inside while we were there, also...great job on the Chesney songs! Whoot! Whoot! for Buffalo Chip!

We went in for a few beers and a bite.  Billy the bartender was absolutely awesome and attentive.  Called us by our first names the entire time we were there.  Made us feel like we were at our local spot back home.  The entire staff was friendly and the food was good.  Highly recommend this place.  We will definitely be back

We have been here several times since moving and my like if this place in waning. The first time we came (a weekday for lunch) it was so tasty! Meat was well flavored, tender and had a nice smokiness to it. I was just certain I would gain a few pounds off of this place. The second and third times have not left me with such warm feelings. The meats have been dry, tasteless and chewy. The service is pretty decent and seating has been plentiful (we go at off peak times). We come here, mainly, because our kiddos can be a little louder and the music drowns them out :) It is a bit pricey and they have a limited menu so you typically have to order something a la carte if you want to try everything (ex: only certain meals come with a biscuit). I think we will be back and try it again, but it will be a while before that happens.

I love this place except for a total bitch of a bartender outside in the food line area. She seemed completely bothered by having to make drinks for my friends and I and also insulted me. She is a blonde who looks pregnant. I was there on Saturday and will not return if she is there. Total bitch!

I had a completely wonderful evening here. had a good amount of drinks at the outdoor bar, watched the amateur bull riding which happens on WED nights, we happened to be there on WED. there were a few hundred people there. Very friendly, family atmosphere. Great place to go with a group of friends or a date. the BBQ plates are stacked high, I shared it with my date because it was a lot of food. I hear bull riding on Friday nights is way better, but I had a great time. We did some dancing inside the dining room area. Very western country vibe, with inhouse country band doing covers of famous country songs, and they do it well.   I would go here again. I loved it. I had a wonderful night.
great fun but poor food and service. Drinks are high in price from other bars in town.

This place has a lot of potential. My family and I really enjoyed the live bull riding, but starting 45 minutes late is unacceptable. It was cold, we had little kids and the place was so packed we had trouble squeezing into the bench seating. Had the show started on time I could probably tell you about the food we had time to order.  Have to admit, I will probably be back. Have the kids better prepared to sit in the bleachers for 45 minutes or maybe eat first. Either way this place seems worthy of a 2nd chance.

The Buffalo Chip is the real deal.  Nothing says the "WEST" like the town of Cave Creek and this place.  Friday and Saturday they have live bull riding competitions.  Fridays are better as they have the pros.  Wednesdays are for the amateurs and anyone else silly enough to sign the waiver and pay the entrance fee.  Outside on the new patio they have a pound of meat (your choice of brisket, ribs, chicken, pork), a roll, corn, potatoes, cold slaw.  It's good.  Bathrooms are well not great.  A 7x10' space they've carved into as many stalls as they possibly can.  Live country western bands play on weekends and the place gets packed.  Fires in the winter keep the outside cozy.

Tex-Mex food comes to the Buffalo Chip saloon!  I stopped by today with the wife for a quick lunch and a nice time out after we attempted to get in to the El Enchanto Mexican restaurant but we forgot that it was Sunday and how much we hated the brunch they serve so we moved on.  On the way up through Cave Creek we passed the Buffalo Chip and I saw a new sign outside announcing Tex-Mex so we pulled a quick right turn into the parking lot and went inside.  The list of food for traditional bar meals was all there...burgers, fries, onion rings, bla, bla, bla... but on the back side was the Tex-Mex menu and it read pretty simple, enchiladas, tacos, chimis, taco salad. You know, the usual.  So I went for the cheese enchiladas with red sauce with a side of rice and the wife ordered a taco salad with shell and all. We also ordered chips and salsa for the wait and I had a very tall cold mug of flat tire amber on draught. Chips were very fresh.  I gotta tell ya' I did not expect to get what I ordered. I was thinking greasy food and lots of tums. What showed up was a very hot plate with two nicely filled cheese enchie's, a side of very fresh rice soft and fluffy and the wife's taco salad with shredded chicken was huge! She liked the fresh chicken and the added in guac and sour cream. They also provide a spicy salsa ranch dressing. The large flour shell was fresh and crispy.  Honestly, We were completely caught off guard.  This was a place I would go back and eat repeatedly. The next time I'll try the shredded beef tacos or a Chicken Chimi!  The only draw back for me is I like hot, spicy hot. The sauce for my taste was a little too flat so out came the hot sauce and my palate was satisfied.  Great experience!  Stew  Best part... It was cheap and you could order all alacart!  Don't be afraid to stop by and check it out!  Stew

Was at the Chip for dinner on 4/8. I ordered steak, my wife ordered a burger. We both made it clear to the server no red in the meat. I cut into my steak and blood comes out of steak. The blood turns the bottom of the biscuit red. My wife's burger was as red on the inside as well. As i cut into my steak a gentleman who seemed to care asked me how are food was. I let him know how it was not cooked the way we asked it to be cooked. He had the food redone   and cooked the way I wanted it. My wife was super hungry and just ate the burger the way she didn't order it. I appreciate the man who came over and checked on us and eventually gave me a steak the way I first ordered it. We will go back to the Chip cause I feel they do care about the customer experience. I really want to give a place 5 stars but most restaurants are not worthy. I think it is best to just stay home and cook my own food.
Pretty much guaranteed a fun nite unless its dead... bullriding, country western dancing, corral to park your horse..... ;)
The Chip is my favorite place to be on a Friday night.  Be prepared for an old style country bar! Dancing, bull riding, fire pits and BBQ!
First and last time there.  Food was not great.  Not impressed.  My husband said his steak was good but 2 of us had the brisket sandwich and it wasn't good.  Very disappointed.

Had a $30 lunch for two. Great outdoor atmosphere. Burger, bbq sandwich and two beers. Not bad at all. Good portion sizes at a $10 price point. Not busy and friendly service. Parking lot is gravel so don't wash ur car ahead of time
Food was good, atmosphere is fun.  If you like country music you'll love this place.

This place is a whole bunch of fun!  We got there around 9 on a Friday and there were still some families inside, but bull-riding and the band had started already.  Everyone was in cowboy boots and cowboy hats were a-plenty as well.  I didn't have any of the food but my friends assured me that the BBQ is top notch.  The biscuits looked heavenly, with butter and honey dripping out of them.    There are three rounds of bull-fighting from 8 to 11ish.  I've never been to a rodeo or anything like that, so I was really into it.  Each round had maybe 6 riders, and in between you can pay $5 to get your picture taken with one of the bulls.  The bleachers tended to fill up well before the round started, so get there a few minutes early to ensure that you have a seat.  It's cool being so close (a few feet away!) to the action.  Afterward we headed inside where the families had cleared out.  There's plenty of seating and the bartenders are fast.  The people on the dance floor ranged from older couples barely moving to younger ones who really knew what they were doing.  As in, girls were flipping and being lifted overhead and who knows what else.  The band is excellent!  All in all, it's a fabulous and fun place to spend a Friday night!

Went to watch and participate in line dancing! It was my first time but it wasn't intimidating. Everyone is just there to have fun. We didn't order food but the bar service was great. It wasn't too crowded on the night that I went but I heard it was light night. There seems to be plenty of both indoor and outdoor space though. The live band was pretty good and made the whole experience more authentic.

The atmosphere was fantastic at this location however the food was lacking. We had a BBQ pork sandwich and felt the sauce was slightly bland and needed something else to add more flavor. We also tried some of the buffet and the beans were less than desired due to lack of flavor. The drive to get there was beautiful and the views make up for the food lacking in flavor. A great spot to relax and enjoy the surroundings but if you are craving real homestyle BBQ I would not make this a first recommendation. The service however was amazing. There were few people sitting outside when we ate and they took good care of us.

We came for lunch and were extremely disappointed! The onion rings and fries weren't fresh but frozen. The hamburger had no flavor  even with green chili on.  How do you mess up a hamburger? My husband's bque platter was just as bad. The sausage was burnt to a little crisp, and the rest was the worst bque he has ever had.  Choose someplace else.

the most authentic south west place you'll find in the phoenix area! i fell in love with the place the first time i came here, and I don't even like country music! The bull riding (Wed and Friday nights), the bon fire pits, the live music (man, those guys can sing!), the dancing, the food (biscuits, s'mores, pulled pork sandwiches)--everything makes this the perfect place! you feel like you're in an old country western movie. They also have the best fourth of July celebration around! I always make sure to bring all of my out of town friends here!
The food was very average. Nothing special. Chicken breast was very dry and the smoked pork sandwich had a lot of fat chunks in it. Live music and fun dancing to watch.

You will find some of the best BBQ in this place. A very fun atmosphere. If you're hungry you don't have to wait long. Don't wear your good shoes there is always a lot of dirt. It's a place to wear the clothes you get dirty in. Boots and cowboy hats are the norm. There is always great entertainment

This is a review of the restaurant, not the bar area. Went with group of 8 people. Seated in the back area where the decor is not very nice. Two round tables stuck together wasn't at all comfortable.the service was extremely slow and the food was mediocre at best. Getting sodas refilled was nearly impossible. Definitely felt like prices were too high for what we got. I don't see another visit anytime in the near future.

We went on xmas day, the food wasn't very good at all. Cheeseburger weren't cooked they way we asked. The chicken sandwich we had was the worst chicken sandwich i ever seen, it was more like a chicken nugget sandwich. Pretty poor excuse for a sandwich.   They weren't really busy at all.  But it took almost an hour to get our food. Are server was SO BAD, (jen) she never came around unless our drinks were empty. Never came to check if we needed anything after see gave us our food.  She needs to get some better server skills. WAS NOT HAPPY WITH HER AT ALL.  We really like the place but no sure if we will return.  Im sure it wont hurt their business if we don't.  Oh and bartender you don't put a lemon in a bloddy mary.  And it sucked anyways.

Not my usual scene, but I had a work event here. The beer is cold, the brisket delicious, and they have live bullriding. Serious. Live bullriding.   The brisket is phenomenal and they have the best fried cheese curds south of Wisconsin.  The patrons are a bit intimidating, but after 2 beers, you won't even care.

We just had lunch there. I ordered a cheeseburger cooked medium. When I took a bite it was almost raw in the middle. Hamburger is not safe to eat less than medium. I asked our server to have it cooked some more.  She brought a new burger out. It was way over cooked, past well done. Also, the replacement burger had one very small tomato and one small slice of onion. I spoke to the manager about my burger. He thanked me for my input. He did NOT comp my meal which I took one bite of. I have been to the Buffalo Chip before. The food was always edible, but not great. I guess I will limit my visits to having a beer in the future. If you want good food there are other places within walking distance. BTW, I grew up in the restaurant business.

Love Buffalo Chip!  I've never eaten here but I dig the atmosphere! Fun crowd, pool table, live band, awesome western decor, live bull riding.... all in all a fun way to spend the night if you are looking for something fun and different from the typical Phoenix bar!
Dance floor is great now, thank you!  but Pleeeeze cut the glare of those bright bright lights on the dance floor by 7PM, thank you!

My husband and his friendgirl wanted to have my birthday dinner here.  Cute place. Andi, our waitress,  was superb, the service was most excellent from everyone who woeked there. However, The food is terrible - I ate very little, and almost everyone in our party got sick.  The menu says baby back ribs but they are NOT baby back ribs.  The drinks are wicked expensive, and I don't think there was any tequila in my margaritas - I had 5 Patron margaritas and felt no buzz at all - stick to beer or shots.
