Super cool place, missed the bull riding but saw the dancing. The bar has a great atmosphere and if I'm ever within 50 miles I'll be back. In fact sat next to a guy who drives 50 miles 3 times a week to be here - respect

Very fun place to go, especially on bull riding nights. Food is good, service fair for the type of place. Bull riding events very fun. Drinks are great. Only gripe I have was the hostess didn't not tell us if you eat outside you can only get buffet and nothing off the regular menu, so from now on before the bull riding I will eat inside, the buffet was not great, the menu dishes are much better. Find the place very friendly and fun. Definitely see it becoming a regular comfort place for us. Also it's a Green Bay Packer hangout! GoPackGo

Have to say...as an out of towner on vacation...this is a MUST VISIT spot!! Folks...1lb of BBQ for $10.95!! Grab that deal and a cold beer and enjoy being outside and taking in the old Western feel. Wednesday nights is amateur bullriding and 730 and 830. One tip, sit in the wood stands as we sat i nthe metal stadium seating and people packed it in and our 3rd row seat was blocked by all the bystanders. Kids, they will let you sit up front and they throw out beads...everyone enjoyed. YES...we will be back!!!

I went on a Wednesday night. I heard about the rodeo show they have. Yet, this is one of those things "been there, done that",  I don't need to return back.  Friendly patrons and the rodeo was fun when they got started, yet it was getting awkward and when they continuously stopped the show to make long, lengthy announcements that no one in the audience cared about...which included politics and stating Sheriff Arpaio was arriving. I'm not from here. AZ and l could care less about the political drawn out statements, over and over again.  Others felt the same, who are long time residents. I left as soon as he arrived and walked to my car and he was still talking.  The rodeo would have gotten at least 4 stars if not without all of the interruption, better parking system and water misters to help cool the public down. It is way too hot to enjoy it.   Strictly dirt parking. Kinda frustrating.  Get there early and if needed park on the upper mound level to avoid waiting on others to leave. Kudos to the bull riders, the sheep and the calf, kiddie riders. They were adorable!

Live bull riding night, bbq galore, indoor and outdoor bar. View of rodeo action can be crowded. At the front door an open barrel of salted peanuts in the shell. You can even toss the peanut shells on the floor.

We wanted a fun night out with the kids and attended the Wednesday night Bull riding and it was a blast.  The BBQ is ok, sides could stand to be upgraded a bit, but the entertainment was outstanding.  I would take friends and family from out of town back.  It was fun and kid friendly!

Great Friday night activity.  I've only been to this place once, but I will definitely go back.  On Fridays, they have an outside BBQ buffet for $10 and you get to watch free bullriding from 8pm to 11pm.  Inside the establishment they had a live country band with line dancing.

We used to love the Chip, it was our go to place when we had company from out of town. The new Chip is missing the special something. The hostesses are rude, the restaurant is just set up in a strange way. We will be back, but we will be sitting outside and will eat somewhere else first. Super disappointing.

Had an awesome time at this place and met some totally random strangers who we partied with all night long. Drinks were cheap and we only had appetizers but they were all good. Our friend rode a bull for the first time ever so that was exciting. Hanging around the fire pits is always good time. Can't wait to try some of the bbq next time.

Holy bull riding batman! Here are some updates since my last review.   Be sure to visit Buffalo Chip Saloon on Friday nights. The professional live bull riding makes it worth the drive, trust me.   Since my last visit, they've built an entirely new edition to the Saloon where they serve the famous BBQ buffet. It's very nice and makes for a good place to sit and eat!   I just love it here. This place is definitely what you would think AZ looks like if you lived elsewhere and had never been to Arizona, but sometimes even the locals need a little tourist social night in their life!

I would not recommend this place to anyone. They double parked behind my car blocking me in so I could not leave. The door man was rude to say the least and when they finally got the car moved (an employees car) the door man was mad because I went over his head to the emanager to get the car moved so he called the sheriffs department and tried to get me arrested for DUI. The police blocked us in our parking spot and wanted to talk to me but when they saw my wife was driving they let us go. I am just saying I would not go back there and would not recommend this to anyone ever. Watch when you leave and be careful or end up in jail. Not really the way to treat your patrons that pay your bills. They manager told me they call on people because if you leave and hurt someone and are drunk it is their responsibility. Not true but all I am saying is be careful with this place if you decide to chance it.

Decided to stop in on Saturday afternoon since it had been awhile since the last time we were in. It was a bit chilly when we came in but they had plenty of heaters on outside and the fire pits going so finding warmth was not ever an issue. We sat at the bar that services the inside and outside and we decided to order some dinner to share. We talked to the bartender Dustin and he explained that we could order from him or we could order from the BBQ bar/stand area and they will bring our food to us. We knew we wanted to just share some brisket and maybe a side. I walked to the BBQ bar/stand and there was a female bartender talking to two other employees and there was no one else around. I walked over and asked if I order from them for some BBQ....they looked at me for a second without saying anything and looked quite confused. After a minute or so I said I just wanted to order a pound of brisket and a side, the bartender proceeded to grab a sheet of paper and say let me check if we even have brisket today...she said no we don't have that but we only have a brisket sandwich....ahhhh what?!? Let me get this straight...you have a brisket sandwich but you don't have brisket? WTF?!? I said I just wanted brisket no sandwich and she again said she didn't have that! The two other employees were just standing there doing absolutely nothing. I walked away and just shook my head and told my boyfriend what had just happened and he was just as confused as I was. I then went back to the bar and ordered from one of the other bartenders working the main bar as I told her I tried ordering from them but they were not helpful at all. They brought out our food and it was quite good. I made a point to get Dustin's name and tell him he was a great bartender as he was! Very attentive, great attitude and service and he deserved to hear he was doing  great job. We will be back again soon but will look for Dustin for the friendly attitude and the great service.

This place is a must stop on Friday nights  when ever we have guests visiting from out of town. Where else can you see live bull riding, lots of fire pits, live country music, numerous bars outside that eliminates the wait for a drink. Have not tried the food. Wear your boots and cowboy hat!

DELICIOUS BBQ, and if you're a fan of country and cowboy-themed restaurants with a large outdoor and patio area, you'll like this place. I've never been in the Cave Creek area, and while this place was pretty far from my place, it was totally worth it.   Now granted, we visited this place on a Sunday afternoon. It was dead at this time, but I've heard rumors it gets really packed Friday and Saturdays.  I got the BBQ platter, which was about $15 total (with tip) and the plate was a nice mix of pulled pork, sausage and some sort of beef strips (forget the name) it was big enough for me to save a good majority of it for leftovers the next day.  Also: They have some sort of offer where you can get a pound of food for ~$10 or something ridiculous like starting at 10 a.m, so I'll try that offer next time I'll be back...and I'll definitely be back. I'd give it five stars but it's really far away from me.

Great fun place to be!   The atmosphere here is awesome! very cool divey country western feel. I came here with some friends for drinks and country dancing. It's quite a drive when your coming from the west side of town. This place is located in the town of crave creek, which seems like it's in the middle of no where. ha ha   The place seem really big on the inside. The dance for was kind of small and I wish they had more restrooms.   We came here on a Saturday night, It was really busy, and lot of people were on the dance floor getting their two step on. They had a live band that sounds really good. Not much for drink speicals though. If you plan on drinking a lot you might want to plan on spending some extra mula.   Very fun place here, great from groups and events.

I have been to this bar a handful of times and I just have to say in comparison to the surrounding bars. The people at three chip are just awful. The girls there are snotty and seem unwilling to meet new people. It seemed as though there was a lot of drama and the bartenders are not very social or friendly. I love bullriding and mutton bustin for the kids but wow, I would rather go to Outlaws down the way, formerly "Outlaw Annie's".

My husband and I visited Arizona for the month of February on our year long trip around the US. While in Phoenix, we were looking for some free, wild wild west fun, and found Buffalo Chips! We had so much fun watching the bull riding, talking to locals, and enjoying a bourbon on the rocks. We did not have any of the food here, but it smelled delish!   We came on a Friday night and it was PACKED! We caught the 8pm bull riding show. The seating is free, and they have experienced riders, first timers, kids, and LITTLE kids who ride sheep! It was a hoot! Great energy, an evident love of the USA, and so much fun.   We were there in February, so it got cool at night, but there are tons of heaters and fire pits around, so you won't get too cold! Before we left, we watched some people dancing inside. One of these days we will take lessons! :)   I actually just wrote about our experience here in my blog post about the Food and Fun in Arizona: https://tandaintheusofa.com/2017/03/16/food-and-fun-in-arizona/

"Terrific Atmosphere / Good Food"  Came in on a Wednesday night and ordered a steak .  The beer was cold and the atmosphere authentic.  What I did not bother to do until I had finished my meal was walk around to the back.   This place is crazy on the weekends and crazy on Wednesdays...  The reason? Bull riding!!!!   Wednesday evening they let the amateurs jump on for a try, so anyone ANYONE could ride on a Wednesday evening under the stars.  The 4* star rather than 5* was just for the food, could be a little better but the BBq Sauce is great , as are the tacos.  Come to this place for a bite and a drink but stay and ride the bull that escaped the grill!

I have mixed feelings about the Chip.  I like the place,  I like the atmosphere,  I like 99% of the clients,  I like the food. SO WHATS THE PROBLEM  I like Captain Morgan and coke. OK fine I like a little Coke with the Cptn Morgan. The drinks inside just never taste right to me. Perhaps it is a "cola" not a Coke perhaps it is a weak pour or bad ice or carbonation issues ... Whatever... I just taste something off.   This does not stop me to partake...just a bother.   OH I don't like getting my feet dirty BUT that is my problem since I choose to not wear shoes or boots there. HAHA

Bull Riding Friday Night is AWESOME!  No cover fee or charge to get in.  Atmosphere and attire are casual laid back country.  Boots to sneakers and fedoras to cowboy hats.  It all works.  Prices are fair and the food is pretty good for typical trash bar food.  Early evening this is a family establishment and it gets rowdier as the night progresses.  Parking is a P.I.T.A. so come early and get a good spot NEAR THE STREET so you don't get pinned in.  ENJOY THE BULL RIDING UP CLOSE AND PERSONAL!

It's a cool concept, and really a great place to take the family, kids and all.  It is kind of a haul to get to, but it's worth it...from time to time. It's spacious and has an authentic old west vibe, complete with cowboys, cowgirls, and rednecks with money. It's nice that they give you the option to eat buffet-style or just order a big juicy burger for $5. The bullriding, though not my thing, was a nice touch. The WTF moment of the night happened though when the bullride MC asked everyone to bow their heads and pray to Jesus. Uhhhh hello? I didn't sign up to go to church, and I don't think it's cool to push YOUR religious beliefs onto a crowd of people who just showed up to eat and watch some live entertainment. That was weird. The rest of my experience was enjoyable though.

I have to disagree with folks who say this place is touristy. Granted, this is THE place to take your out-of-town visitors. Last time I was here we had a friend from Australia and she was over-the-moon at her first real American experience. So yes, a lot of out-of-towners. But you CAN'T tell me that the folks tearing up the dance floor on any given Friday are your Uncle Murray and Aunt Sybil visiting from Boca.  This is a fun place with a nice old west feel. They have great live music, the afore mentioned dancing, reasonably priced drinks, pool tables, a HUGE patio....and as others have mentioned, LIVE bull riding. I really need to come here more often because it is one of the funnest places in The Valley and you really feel like you're away from it all. Yes it gets uber-crowded, the line to the men's room is a long as the line to the ladies room and you're really kinda screwed if you really came here to play pool, but if there is ANY place you should take it all in stride, it's here.  And seriously folks, quit bitching about the food. It's a $20 steak for God's sake. You get what you pay for and frankly it's pretty damned good-better than Outback or Applebee's. If that's not good enough then go to Mastro's and bring your own bull.  Good times and I highly recommend.

Very disappointed.  This place was recommended to me by the gentlemen at sabas.  It was Saturday night and my girlfriend and I got all dressed up and headed down to the buffalo chip for a fun evening.  I had previously viewed the menu online and was craving something special.  Well when I pulled up in my truck,  some good music was playing.  We approached the back entrance and two bouncers asked for ID.  We are both 20 and got denied access.  I asked "so we can't even eat here?" and he said no.  Ruined our experience and couldn't have been more disappointed. We are on a tight budget and don't get to go out often and sadly this is what we faced.

I went to the Buffalo Chip Saloon on Friday a couple of weeks back and had a great time. Being a native of Arizona I'm no stranger to country western restaurants and bars. The Buffalo Chip is probably one of the best. Friday nights is all you can eat fish fry with delicious cod that would make even a non fish lovers mouth water.   The only thing better than the food was the service. Despite it's popularity in Cave Creek and the valley for that matter, service was fantastic. Our server was on point with drink refills and getting our food out quick.  The Buffalo Chip offers a full bar and great atmosphere for adults and children. I really have nothing bad to say about this place. I would highly recommend it to anyone willing to make the trip to Cave Creek.  OH...I almost forgot. Bull riding on Friday nights also. Free entertainment with an outdoor bar. Great for the kids too.

Well, we went to the Buffalo Chip today during the bike run.  We were told by the cashier to "go ahead and have a seat anywhere", so we chose a table, tried to sit down but I banged my knee on the table stand because the chair wouldn't move due to the tables being too close together, so we moved to a more acceptable spot.  I have to say, the seating was NOT comfortable and the tables just didn't seem wide enough to fit multiple items... now, I wouldn't know this for sure because after 15 mins of sitting, pretty much next to the kitchen entry, being passed by MULTIPLE employees and watching 2 tables get help AFTER us, we were NEVER helped and we left.  Now, before you say "oh, it was their grand opening, they were probably busy"...no.  We were there around 4:15pm and there were more employees/waitresses, than there were customers at this time.  NO EXCUSE acceptable, for what happened and very disheartening, considering the amazing review I left for them a year ago.  The lady  manager/ possibly the owner said "thanks for coming" and I had to let her know that we waited with no help.  No attempt to fix the matter and let us leave with no apology.  I just recommended them 2 days ago... that referral will be intercepted and we will NOT return.  Plus, not very warm and inviting with seats that made you want to stay and buy more, with this new remodel... It's a shame.  I'm sure they'll do fine and I do wish then luck, but no longer my cup of tea.

I went to the pre-opening dance party. I was impressed with their high quality wood dance floor but I was disappointed that it wasn't larger. For country dancing it will be a tight squeeze on busy nights.  They had a good live band and a free dance lesson. There were too many people to give a viable lesson but they tried. Sound acoustics seemed to be good throughout the dining room area and bars.   Overall the Chip rebuild is impressive. It will be a popular party place and hangout in the winter months.  The food was mediocre bar fare. My partner and I did give the fried sweet potatoes a thumbs up.  I was told by the waitress that they are using a temporary kitchen and she reassured me the food will improve.   Parking in the dirt wasn't fun. I hope I didn't get Valley Fever. Cough! Cough!  There isn't much reason for me to drive the 45 miles to get there because I have better options that are much closer, so I won't be inhabiting this venue very often.   For many of the regular patrons, the Buffalo Chip has a mystical aura of Brobdingnagian significance. I call these cultists the "Chippers". While practically living at the Chip they learned to dance, and many of them had torrid romances -- and perhaps a few got hitched.. I'm sure many of the children that resulted from that cowboy social scene can be seen at the Chip to this day. For the disciples of the Chip, no rating less than 5 will ever do. (Sorry Folks!) I have no doubt that if I come back when the Chip is completed I will upgrade my rating to a 4 or 5.

Hey Y'all!  No freakin way does a place like this exist. Completely surreal!  I like my country but this is something you have to be in a Honky Tonk mood for!!   You walk in and there is a big bon fire going on with picnic benches and people eating off of paper plates as there is 10.00 all you can eat BBQ going on. seriously. They have an outdoor bull riding ring that starts around 7. And these are real bulls with semi professionals and rodeo clowns and everything. none of that mechanical wimpy stuff.  there are three rounds and they always start of with a little kid riding a lamb. so cute. The bull riding is legit and so fun, definitely a fun crowd!  in between the bull rides you can go inside to listen to a live band! They totally rock my socks! There wasn't any line dancing going on to my dismay but it was fun dancing and singing. Well a funny moment came when they were to sing "Save a house, ride a cowboy" and he was reading the lyrics off of his blackberry. At first I thought he was texting, but no he was reading. I mean who whips out their blackberry when they are on stage?  The food, is, well, country food. fried fries, fried chicken, brisket, fried fish-you get the idea. The BEST is the smores! they give you a little fire, skewers and enough fixins for 6 smores! :) yeee haw!

This place is fun.  Just how you would expect a Cave Creek bar to be.  Nice country music and dancing or you can go outside for bbq, fire pit, and bull riding.  The food is pretty good, prices are reasonable, and the beer is cold.  The parking is the worst ever.  I've seen people get pinned in and cars bumped.  I ended up with a large dent in my car once.  Take your beat up road warrior car and enjoy.

The bartender "Texas" is a sad excuse for one. Her shift was about to end and we had just closed out with her. She had another bartender come over and ask (while we were talking to people we'd just met) what we would tip her since she was leaving. Millennial problems and COMPLETELY UNPROFESSIONAL. During all my years bartending if your shift ended and you closed someone out, the next shift would put your tip in an envelope or hold it in some fashion but what she did was pretty unprofessional. Bartenders before her slung drinks for a lot less per hour and were a lot more professional. The gentleman working with her was nice and engaging but she was a sour

Buffalo Chip is full of real-life cowboys. I felt like I walked into a country western film when we got here. The main restaurant was a normal looking sports bar, but when we got out back it was another story with the pen for bull riding.  For $20 a person, we went up to the VIP section which was made the weekend for two eager little boys. We had great seats, and a server for food and drinks. It was really busy in the VIP section, and we only had one server so everything was a bit slower than expected. Our server was doing her best, but it would be nice if they had another server to help her out.   We stayed for appetizers, drinks, dinner for the munchkins and 10 or so bull riders. The food was so so, but the drinks were strong, and the entertainment was top notch. I'd certainly recommend planning a night out to Buffalo Chip.   The only downside is that it's a Packer's bar, and I'm a Steeler's fan. Apparently, there's a Steeler's bar next door though!

I tried going here once but left after 20 minutes of waiting for someone... anyone... to give us a menu or take our drink order. The place was empty except for 2 people at the bar, which is where we probably should have sat if we wanted service.   Maybe the food is good? I would have liked to find out.

Oh Lord somehow I have wound up in Cave Creek down at the Buffalo Chip Salon,  I guess this place during the day is restaurant and I'm sure even at 11 they were cooking some beef cuz I sure was smelling the bbq and thinking damn that smells good, yea wasn't thinking about food till I smelt the bbq! But didn't get any but did have me another whiskey and coke, guess that was my drink for the night  So if you're into cowboys, hunny this is your place! It must be the mecca for the cowboys, they were everywhere, Also there was a live band playing loud and proud, dance floor was small, inside seemed to be a tab bit small to me too and crowded, I don't like when its elbow to elbow of people, I like to people watch, look around till a spot a fly guy and then go talk to him, but here to move around was a big production.     Sometimes it's not about the place you are at, but with the company you keep, I did have a good time at the buffalo chip, but it was due to hanging out with my girlfriends on a Friday night! My dd and I bounced after 40 mins, again if you're into loud country music and tons of cowboys, this is your place!   DD & I hit the road to go check out a dive bar in the valley
Such a gnarly experience!!! Parking was rough so get there early. Beer was cheap, live band was great, bull riding was so fun to watch! Buffalo Chip, thank you!!!
Killer catfish going on at this place! Friendly bartender and server. Nice rodeo style bar. Came early to eat but looks like a nice dance floor for later in the evenings.
Wonderful place. Service is tremendous Couldn't ask for a more enjoyable bartender. Bill is the best. The beef brisket street taco can't be any better.  Recommend it to everybody.

I absolutely hate writing this review.  I've been going to the Buffalo Chip since I was a kid, and frequented the restaurant during the day and the festivities in the night for decades. Pre-fire it was the best burger around.  However the fire claimed the souls of the buffalo chip.  The new building is stark and not dissimilar to other establishments within blocks. The "old" buffalo chip was warm and cozy, albeit haphazard and short restrooms. The new buffalo chip is like a Texas Roadhouse. A missed opportunity. Secondly, the food isn't at all the same. The burgers have dirt cheap buns which disintegrate upon handling and the meat has lost all its pre-fire character. Nothing special anymore.   It hurts the heart to see what happened.  Larry missed it on the rebuild though, and it just isn't the old Buffalo Chip anymore. With some more focus on recreating the feel we all loved (yes with some more bathrooms) and an exact replica of the system used to produce such wonderful burgers would have been all that was needed to turn this back into a 5 star destination.
We went during the all you can eat BBQ which was really good. I couldn't get enough of the ribs and shredded pork. I'm assuming their BBQ sauce is house made and boy was it good!

My wife and I went to Buffalo Chip Saloon for a birthday party.  It was fairly easy to find as I don't go to Cave Creek all that often.  So here's the run down:  Pros -Good food.  You may want to avoid if you are a vegetarian but I mean...really...it says steakhouse in the name.  -Great atmosphere.  We were out in the back area and they had bull riding and good country music blasting.    -Great staff. They were prompt and really nice for as crazy as their system is (More on that in the Cons). I had a fly in my beverage when it came out and she apologized profusely and quickly went and got me a fly free beverage.  We were outside, it's not like we were inside and there was a fly in my food.    Cons  -Payment system. In the day and age of identity theft, I am not a fan of letting my credit/debit card out of sight.  This place takes your card, until you leave.  Seriously.  I'm sorry but that is beyond crazy.  So far, I've not see any "extra" charges on my card so I guess they are trustworthy.   -Ordering food was not clear.  It may have been just because we were part of a large group but it was just kind of "we do what now?" Never saw a menu, we just did an outdoor buffet.   Summary Go check them out if you like good food and country music and don't mind total strangers holding on to your credit cards for indeterminate amounts of time.

The atmosphere of the place is really nice and the wait staff were great as well. If I scored the place solely on those two things I'd give them a 4 out of 5. My score is for the food only, which is literally terrible. The prices are great but the food is so bad it still doesn't justify the cost. The buffet area had no serving spoons for the condiments- literally none. The storage tub to cool the condiments was warm and the water underneath was warm and all the ice was gone (yes, I moved the metal food bins to see if it was cold before eating the coleslaw so I didn't get food poisoning). Without a functioning cold bin the coleslaw and ranch was stored at outdoor temps which is just food poisoning sitting there, yours for the taking. That is, if you could find something to scoop your food poising up with. In the kitchen there were two people handling and getting food ready for plates with no gloves on, just their bare hands all over your biscuits and fries. Two others did have gloves, one of which was an older man working the grill while eating his dinner- what looked like a taco(?!?!?) with his gloves on. I cannot make this up, he's grilling and eating his dinner at the same time. Food prep 101- you can't eat your dinner while making other people's food and the fact that you just ate a what appeared to be a taco of sorts renders your sanitary gloves absolutely useless. The BBQ is completely void of taste and the biscuits taste exactly like KFC. the ribs, chicken, etc. taste like they're frozen and then reheated and they leave it to you add BBQ sauce which I had to scoop from an open tub with a plastic condiment container (like the to-go salsa containers from Rubios) because there wasn't a serving spoon in that either. After seeing all the sanitary signs you may wonder why I even ate the food at all (I am wondering the same thing myself) but we had been at the lake earlier and we were really hungry and didn't want to wait another 40 minutes to get home. This was a bad decision as I felt more sick with every mile closer to home and ended up throwing up as soon as I got there. I am convinced any of the reviews that say the food is good, they have either never eaten BBQ in their life or were completely trashed and couldn't taste the food they were eating. For the price, you could go to Famous Dave's and at least have half decent chain BBQ instead of these frozen concoctions. I should say that the burgers aren't any better they taste like frozen patties as well and are cooked to a hockey puck consistency by the old man eating his tacos at the grill. The cheese on the burgers tastes like great value "cheese" that doesn't actually taste like cheese- you know that thick waxy government cheese they used to dole out in the 80s. If you want food because your hungry go anywhere else, literally anywhere- there is a circle k a 1/2 mile down the road, stop there. If you're going here just for the bar, eat up and ask for seconds. After a few drinks you won't taste anything you're eating and after a few more you won't remember what it tasted like coming up either.

Just Celebrated my Sisters Birthday here, and we all had a Fabulous time !  they had a Great Band!  the food we had was greasy and good !  the Smores were the best, not too many Restaurants offer Smores, also it was a thursday night that we went, and they had a free Dance Lesson, which was so much fun, would difinitely recommend this place for a FUN time !
Great atmosphere. We take our out of town guests here for a unique experience and fantastic brisket. Young and old alike love to people watch and try the bbq.

We waited 10 minuets at the outside area to be served. The bartender and server looked right at us but never came to our table. The atmosphere was awesome but the service sucked! The sad thing is it was Sunday and not busy!

If it were possible, I would have given this a negative 10; the absolute worst experience of our lives. I went in there at approximately 2:00 today (Sunday) with my husband and son. it was relatively empty ( maybe three other tables of customers , but several dirty tables that were sitting unbussed). There was no one at the hostess stand, but to the right were two girls behind the bar; presumably bartenders. They saw us standing there for over five minutes and said nothing. I walked the two feet over to them and asked them whether we should seat ourselves, even though the sign said the hostess would do so. They ignored me. I asked again and one snapped "yeah" My husband said we should leave and go to the Horny Toad, but I wanted to give this place a try. My son said the bartenders were disgustingly rude and he too would prefer to go elsewhere.  My choice was to give them a try. We sat at a table and waited for a waitress. We waited and waited and waited.Two gals were walking around, one of which was messing with the TV right above our table.  They would not make eye contact, but knew we were there. We sat there almost 15 minutes with these two gals walking right by us and neither was doing anything! The people next to us were waiting for drink refills and were livid. We got up and yes, one of them saw us and we left. UNBELIEVABLE!! I called thirty minutes later to speak to the manager and the girl who answered the phone said she was too busy to talk to me and what was the problem. I told her I needed to speak with the manager and she refused to see if she would take the call. I told her what happened and here is what she said: The two bartenders were ignoring me because they were supposed to be " off the clock" and didn't feel they needed to acknowledge a customer. She didn't seem to have an issue with their rudeness. The reason we weren't waited on or approached was because they were having computer issues. When I tell you that this pathetic excuse for an employee couldn't care less...I cannot stress this enough. I told her a simple waive from one of the girls, as in we will be right with you, would have been fine. The place was filthy with more dirty tables than clean ones, we have NEVER seen a staff as rude, disgusting  and unprofessional as this in our lives. I cannot imagine allowing customers to be treated so poorly. We will never go back and we will make certain that every single person we know never steps foot in that place. There are several fantastic eateries within steps of that place; do yourself a favor and go there!NEGATIVE 10 folks!!

One of the worst experiences I have ever had. I have eaten here before during daytime family hours with no issues. Today, my nephews were visiting and love cowboys. Everything went downhill from there. I called and asked if the restuarant was air conditioned because I know it is an indoor/outdoor place. I was told yes. It was as hot inside as it was outside and it is a dangerous temperature for kids to be in for really any amount of time. In addition, flies were everywhere, landing on us, and food, when it arrivee. Then the food ordered off the kids menu was served extremely hot and of course it won't cool down when it is 110 in the resturaunt. Then the blairing music and then the manager topped it off. As he walking around, he starts rubbing my nephew's head, my nephew has his back to him, and my nephew is completely freaked out. DON'T TOUCH OTHER PEOPLES KIDS! He started talking to us and it was obvious we were not interested because my wife and were desperate to keep the kids from overheating - manager did not get it. It was awful as an adult and even worse for the kids. This was about 5pm on a Sunday last I checked still family hours. Won't be going back. Would never recommend.

Ok, honestly this is not going to be everyone's bag. But I LOVE going to Buffalo Chip. Throw on my cowboy boots, have a chance to wear denim on denim (oh hell yes I did!) & just let my wild hair down.   PBR out of a mason jar. Professional bull riding on Fridays & amateurs on Wednesdays (my guy friends' favorite new activity). Two-stepping to live bands. Fire pits out back. Cheap, delicious BBQ that looks as unhealthy as it is for you...but that makes it so much more yummy.  There is no pretension here. Everyone is just hanging out, having a good time. Talk to strangers. Everyone just seems genuinely nice. The walls are covered with cool shit & it definitely feels like I think AZ felt like back in the day.  Take a trip...Cave Creek is so much fun, & the Buffalo Chip is one of my favorites.
Best cheese Curds I've ever had! Atmosphere is great! The rodeos and bonfires are pretty cool!

Buffalo Chip is like another world!  We love living in downtown Phoenix, but this place is a great getaway for the night.  If feels like another world.  The dance floor is always packed and drinks flow freely.  The food is ok, but nothing great.    The live bull riding on Friday nights pack this place out, but its also worth it...   Super fun. Great place to go with a group of friends.  Just make sure you whip out your wranglers and boots before hitting it up.

Our first visit and not our last. The food, drinks, service and Band were all better than average. Not only did we enjoy the saloon, but the other patrons in the saloon were fun to be around. Looking forward to our next visit.

One of the few true Cowboy bars left in Arizona, and this place is a run down and rusty house of fun.  The food is good, especially the Friday night fish fry, and the beer and food is inexpensive and well made.  A Green Bay Packer bar, the place hops on Sundays.  Go there, dress casually and have a nice time.

This place is full of flies..... because of the rodeo. You cannot eat without having to swat away flies off your food.  There are ways to deal with flies but these places do not even put the effort.  Maybe they think it adds to the ambiance. The women behind the bar tend to keep the change if it is within $4 or $5 dollars assuming it is their tip when you pay in cash and that is on a $5 purchase!!! That is something I have never experienced before. I guess they think they are pretty special. One time we were there the Barmaid carried her 2 year old around behind the bar then sat him down on the bar. I guess that is OK too.  They are over priced now from what it was before they burned down the place. Their drinks are now watered down and they and twice the price. Not a place I can recommend. there are better places in Cave Creek.

This is our second visit and a tradition we'll continue to keep.  The place was packed with locals and tourists.  It's loud and bawdy with a down home atmosphere.  Reservations are accepted and strongly recommended, however our hostess was accommodating and found us a spot.  We chose to eat inside the saloon.  If coming with kids, eat outdoors around the pits.  Our server, while very nice, wore a very small top which was inappropriate and embarrassing.  It was appeared to be standard attire for most of the servers.  The food is good barbecue.  The portions are a good size.  Split the salads as they are large.  There was live music, plenty of dancing and a gal swinging from the ceiling.  The rodeo starts with prayer and the national anthem.  Even inside, everyone stood in silence and then erupted in applause following the final notes.  The mutton busting can't be beat.  The stands were packed.  If in Cave Creek you don't want to miss this gem.  You'll be glad you did.  Make sure to grab a T-shirt or hoodie to commemorate the evening.  It comes in handy too, as it can be chilly in the stands.  Yes Haw!

Very eclectic and inviting interior.  Get to see a bit of Old West history both inside and out.  The staff were very happy, helpful, and attentive.  Started with cheese curds--which were delicious.  The buffalo stew was very, very tasty.  Ribs--HUGE portion, but did not have very much flavor.  I will agree with the other reviews which state that the sauce is very bland--and they liberally slather it on.  Both ends of the ribs were so tough that they were inedible, and the spine section was liberally coated in fat which I had to cut away.  $40 for two--no drinks.  Did not leave hungry!  I would have given 4 stars for the ambiance and excellent service; knocked it down to 3 for the ribs.

LIVE BULL RIDING FOLKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   Wednesday nights are armature nights (though you could have fooled me)   The hubs and I headed up as our friends son is apprenticing to be a rodeo clown (Who knew that was possible)   We had a total blast! Those bulls are feisty!   We didn't make it inside, but could hear the live band jamming out. We did hit up the BBQ buffet, pretty dang tasty. For $10 you get a POUND of meat, 2 sides and a biscuit. The hubs and I split a plate and they let you get several different kinds of meat, whatever adds up to a pound.   We will be going back up here again real soon.

An amazing country western good time at the Buffalo Chip.  An ABSOLUTELY MUST TRY when in Cave Creek, AZ.  Came to visit friends building a home in the area.  They suggested the Buffalo Chip as an after dinner drinking hole. We were pleasantly surprised by the ultra friendly staff and patrons, the entertainment, the bull riding, the food and drink.    What a memorable experience.  We'll be back for another round.

I usually only write reviews for bad experiences. This place was so fun i had to write a review. I had an exceptional time watching friday night bull riding and line dancing, both new experiences for me. Everyone was really nice (huge age range), awesome vibe, and the band was good. I'm not a cowboy by any means but I love country music, which is definitely required here. I live in Scottsdale and had to drive about 40 minutes. It was well worth the drive. I will come back for sure. More fun than penthouse suite parties at the Bellagio and rooftop nightclubs in LA, both of which I got to experience recently, and both cost more. Can't say enough about how much fun I had.

Stopped in during bike week, bars across the street were to crowded to find a place to sit to eat. Service was good, food okay, place is only 6 months old. Just ok not special. At the bars across the street music was pounding, wait staff in fishnets and thongs and people having a good time.

Must say I loved this place before but the other night we got up to the bar and ordered drinks and the next thing we know we are being escorted out under a false accusations.  Really not happy, and it left us in a very scary situation to follow.  Long story, but just wanted to say thanks Buffalo Chip!  Might want to review your security staff, I felt strongly that there is something shady going on with them.

I was planning on eating/watching bull ridding here the other night. Went with my 26 year old sister and was told by the security guard that I wasn't aloud to enter since I'm only 19. Seriously this rule is RIDICULOUS if all you wanted to do is eat. My family was actually shocked when I went home and told them. We will from now on eat at Harold's since all ages are welcome.

Half beer butt chicken breast was dry  Half rack ribs meat was tender and smothered in the tasty Bbq sauce (which hubby didn't like; he likes sweeter sauces and this one was smoky) Sweet potato fries- sauce it came w was soooo yummy  Busy Wednesday so service was good at first but when the place packed up we didn't see our waitress, which was pretty much the whole time we ate our dinner.  This place has bull riding and a live band on Wednesdays so it was good to be in one place for food and entertainment. And cheap drinks which is always a nice surprise when you're from LA.

The Chip is a staple for us! Since rebuilding last year, the back patio area is much nicer. The service is what you'd expect for a western bar (a little attitude but fun people), but the drinks and vibe are perfect. Definitely break out your boots and prepare for some dust. My favorite is Friday nights to watch bull riding! The food is pretty solid for bar food. Bring a big group and enjoy an adult night out!

Buffalo Chip Saloon and Steakhouse... I adore you  Why, most of you ask? I am a true wisconsinite! And buffalo chip is where we belong! Cheese curds, Broasted chicken, beer chasers with our bloody mary's... heck to the yes!   Us cheese heads have to stick together and I am glad I found my spot!   Baffalo Chip Saloon and Steakhouse... As a wisconsinite and cheese curd and broasted chicken loving girl... my heart and soul is yours as long as you support the packers!   plus the food and service is amazing, even if you aren't all about all things Wisconsin (which, I frankly will never understand!)
Super nice and attentive staff. Thank you Taryn! My burger was a generous size and perfectly cooked. Craft beer drinkers in my party were impressed with beer selection. Solid choice in the area.
Nice place! Good food and drinks, fun entertainment with bull riding and live music. Definitely doesn't feel like you're in the city anymore. When you have visitors in PHX, take them here!

I wish we found this place sooner in our trip! We found it only an hour before leaving for our flight! We loved the atmosphere, felt like an old saloon, with boots and photos on the ceiling - where the locals hung out (not sure if they did but our bartender the night before was heading there after work!) Between the 5 of us we had the beef brisket and pulled pork which everyone loved. We had the sweet potato fries (yum) and s'mores (fantastic!). We only got to see the first 15 minutes of country dancing, but I will be back to see more and definitely dance next time we fly in! We had a great time while we were there, a dinner full of laughs. If you want a place with a great atmosphere, this is your place
This place is unique and a fixture of Cave Creek. The bull riding is awesome. The food could be better, but you won't find an atmosphere like this anywhere else. Buffalo Chip screams "Arizona!"

Due to Lent, we enjoyed the fish selection in the buffet on Friday night.  The buffet included a great selection of bbq items & sides also.  The cost was $15.95 for a 1.5 lb plate full of food.  The place was packed with people, the outdoor bull riding ambiance was fun & family friendly people was all around.  We will return & recommend to friends!

Stopped in here after buying a house close to this landmark.  We were not disappointed.  It was mid-day and there was live music and great staff and great food.  The waitress whipped up her own version of a steakhouse sauce for my husband and it was amazing!!!!!!  So excited to be moving closer and we will be there often!

I finally got to experience this place late night snce we got a hotel.  Oh my word. Horses out front, cowboys all over the place and the dancing.. wow the dancing.  You know that wedding reception scene in Steel Magnolias?  That's what you see.  Amazing.  Tons of line dancing as well.     Live music inside, but outside....  bullriding!   So much fun to sit in the stands and watch people ride bulls. They kinda sucked, but who am I to judge?  It was still fantastic.    The bar is PACKED at night and the drinks are cheap.  Good food and fun times.

Eat before you get there but stay for drinks and the atmosphere.  We spent $75 on food that wasn't very good and ended up get soggy because we got caught in a quick rain storm. Since all the seating is outside we had limited places to seek cover. I never complain when AZ gets rain but our dinners got wet and we ended up throwing it all out. We had out of town guests with us which made it that much more disappointing.  We enjoyed watching the bull riding and live band. The kids had fun dancing to the music and making s'mores.

The food here is very good solid western food. But you MUST go to see the live professional bull riders on Wednesday or Friday!!! Lots of fun!!! I have been going there for over 10 years whenever I am in Scottsdale or Cave Creek. Well worth a trip up to Cave Creek from anywhere in the valley of the sun.

Wow, what a tourist trap.   Which is how we found ourselves there, in Cave Creek, an hour from our home. We were there because out of town guests wanted to go there. We wouldn't have chosen to go here on our own.  From the second we walked in, you can see it's very Country Western themed. Boots hanging from ceiling, pictures and art, wooden tables. But it's nothing you can't get at other restaurants around town.   We had reservations but arrived early, so had to wait about 10 minutes. It was packed. Our table was not cleaned off before we were sat there & there were holes in my chair. Service was adequate, but nothing too friendly or fast. You could tell our server was overwhelmed- "in the weeds." Our table was in the worst location- back corner by the bar & server station so I had people standing over me to get to the bar, knocking my chair (one lady's purse hit me in the head as she squeezed past), and servers dropping plates or talking to each other about their customers. Trust me, I get it- I waited tables for years & we talked about customers too. But never where other customers could hear us! Speaking of hearing, the restaurant was LOUD! Mostly because it was packed but music was on too. I was in a party of 4- 2 people had the fish fry, 1 had steak & I had the chicken sandwich. The food was awful! All meals came out cold with the exception of the steak. The fries are the kind of Ore Ida you can get at the store (not crinkle cut though) and everything was bland. My chicken sandwich had green chilis on it & they had no flavor at all. I doused it with salt & pepper & tried to choke down cold fries with ranch that didn't taste good either (you know when something doesn't taste right but you can't explain it? That was the ranch). The only person who finished their meal was the 1 who had the steak & we all agreed we should've had that. At least it wasn't a rip off- all meals were in $10 range except for steak which I think was $17. But as terrible as the food was, you couldn't pay me to eat it again.  We finished our meal & went outside to check out the bull riding. Here's why I give BC 2 stars instead of 1-- it's a cool set up outside. Several bars & beer tubs, an arena for bull riding, picnic tables & bonfires. The people watching is First Class- tourists, cougars, teens, cowboys. Crowd seemed to be about 85% over the age of 45 & more tourists than locals. It was crowded & at times seemed like a meat market. Bull riding takes place at 8, 9, & 10 and you should get there early to sit in arena.   Inside, half of the restaurant had been cleared of tables, a live country cover band was playing & people were dancing. Sorry- just seemed hokey to us. Again, it was crowded. The guys who had the pool tables couldn't even play because of people crowded around them.   I wasn't impressed & doubt I'll be back unless dragged all the way up there again. And one things for sure, I will not eat there ever again- BLECH! Sit in the back, drink beers & enjoy people watching.
A lot of fun!  Friday nights live Bull Riding out back!  Outdoor bonfire!  Really something different!

A unique place. Was open on Christmas day a few years ago and we ate there outside and took our dog with us. (we had just hiked in the Spur Cross) . Have gone back a few times and its a favorite of our family. Our kids always ask to go back. Just a fun place to eat and hang out.

Went there with my girls. I like the remodeling and I even got my girl to sit on a bull with her pretty dress. The people are super cool and the dancing is fun. We're up here all the time. Makes me feel like home.

BRIITANY, daytime bartender  Great food suggestions & drinks!! Didn't know what I wanted. Made 2 AWESOME Britfany bar specials. We ate Pork sandwhich, no bread  tasted incredibly delious as well as brisket sandwich. I made it open face, rarely ever finish a meal. I ate 75% of my entire lunch.  BEST lunch & service in a long time. Thx Brittany

This is one of my favorite places to go for bbq. The pulled pork is amazing and the drinks are even better. Just a cute family place with a western feel. The s'mores for dessert are my favorite part and the service is great! I will continue to come back!
This place is huge! No need to get to dressed up it's like being out at the barn. Such a good time watching the bull riding. The MC is hilarious!

What an experience! Really fun family activity that shows off the true southwest history in Arizona. I split the hamburger with a friend, which was extremely yummy (but I was still hungry and they charge $3 for splitting so I wouldn't recommend splitting). Fries were also very good! Reasonable prices for food and drinks. The bull riding was extremely entertaining! Which if I recall correctly is Wednesdays and Fridays only. I would recommend making a reservation, we weren't able to find a table for four and sat at the bar. Children riding sheep is a little crazy and kind of sad to watch, but I guess it's part of the experience! Round up the whole fam and get out there!

Food was good but needed more choices for the bbq sauce. Only had one. Pulled pork sandwich was tasty. Bbq platter was a lot of food but was just ok in taste. Blue cheese wedge was pricey but delicious. S'mores seemed old but liked that you could cook your marshmallow over the fire. Got to see Bull riding and a band.

The Buffalo Chip, Cave Creek, AZ! We ended our road trip on Sunday there for dinner. Your new structure is awesome. As we drove through town we knew we had to eat there! I switched up my wine for a cool refreshing Gin and Tonic. Gary got iced tea, lots of ice! We had to ask for a glass of ice, NO Charge! The tonic was "flat". I thought it was Gin and water. So, we tell the waitress. Who was very nice and offered a new one. Now, I would think the bartender would, at this point, check the tonic water. But No... I get a second...FLAT! Order dinner. I order Catfish and Gary a Brisket sandwich, no cheese, can he get a couple onions. The waitress says she cannot promise the onion. Sometimes when she puts in the order it is not transferred correct. OK... Dinner comes out. Oh no, thanks for the onion, but I can't eat cheese. So back it goes. Now, the very best thing about bar food??? The hot crispy French Fries! The buffalo Chips serves their French Fries pale and limp! Two small pieces of fish. And when the brisket sandwich finally did come back out, it had half the meat the first one had and half of that was fat.  Scott the manager comes around and we tell him about the drink. He did offer another or take it off the tab. I choose to have it taken off. We were finished eating. Now the bill comes. The brisket sandwich was clearly $9 on the menu, yet bill said $10. I point this out to Scott. He tells me it was because Gary asked for onion. Yet it did not show $1 for onion and no credit for NO Cheese. It clearly had the sandwich was $10.  You know what Scott; you owe that waitress and bartender a tip. They clearly work for you. I am of the belief your employees cut corners where they are told by management. I will never go back and that is sad, The Buffalo Chip is such an Icon in Cave Creek. If you go... stick to the beer or wine and make sure you get your onions to go.

YOU HAVE TO CHECK IT OUT! AWESOME FUN FAMILY NIGHT! What a great place to have a great night! Awesome food spectacular entertainment...live bands and line dancin and a live band and to top it all off watching the bull riding with great music played with a hilarious DJ! I highly recommend this place! Can't wait to come back here!

Just visited Buffalo Chip on February 7th and they have an AWESOME barbecue buffet going on right now for just $12.00 with tax.  Saturdays and Sundays in the afternoon until (I believe) 6:00 pm.    They had the following meats and sides ALL YOU CAN EAT:    Beef Brisket (Unsauced - they have two delish sauces) Pulled Pork (Unsauced) Texas Sausage (YUM!) BBQ Chicken Legs & Thighs Rib Tips (pork) Burnt Ends (beef) - YUM!  Included sides are Honey Butter Biscuits, Cowboy Beans (pinto), Mixed Vegetables & Coleslaw  It's the best BBQ I've had in awhile, great value and SUPER TASTY!  I left in a wonderful meat coma.  Will be back again February 21st!

The food was good and the price was right but we musta overlooked the fact that on Friday nights they let anyone with big enough balls who is drunk enough, ride a bull to the amusement of hundreds of people. Talk about some great Friday night entertainment!

Just went for a few beers and ended up at Da Shack in Da Back. Good service and nice to have the misters on such a hot Saturday afternoon! My only complaint was all the flies!!! If they hooked up a fan or two, I'm sure that would solve the problem. Considering going back to try the food cause the smoke smell was very inticing!

I was there with my family for the grand opening. The Chip was always one of my favorite places for the atmosphere & the Pat James Band (I miss the traditional country music) We got there early (still daylight) to see everything before it got too busy.  For the most part I liked it... the food was mediocre at best.  2 of us had the BBQ "buffet". It was greater than 50% fat & mostly not edible, 2 had the burger & were pleased.  The dance floor was smaller than I hoped.  But where was the Buffalo??  We finally asked... they have it poorly displayed above the stage where it's blocked by the lights & not positioned properly for the correct view. I hope they rethink where that beautiful beast calls home.  It seems the Buffalo Chip bison should have a more centrally located home where everyone can see him from any place in the bar.   Still a great place & I'm sure will only get better with time.

We assisted with a Rehearsal Dinner at BC.  The Staff at Buffalo Chip were exceptional!  From helping with decorating to inviting guests to sample s'mores around a fire pit, the staff was so attentive!  The food was outstanding!  Thanks to all at Buffalo Chip that made the party so awesome! Highly recommend BC for your next large group function!

It's been so long! Fire destroyed this place almost a year ago, two weeks from reopening 100%. The new restaurant looks incredible. But these guys never put their head in the sand, have been open ever since. Always a great place to come for barbecue. Coming out with a new menu when they reopen. Totally worth checking out. Great great food and at a fair price
D from Iowa and this the best bar/saloon in Arizona that I have visited! Dustin, Matt, Nicole and manager Keleigh have been FANTASTIC! So attentive and FUN!! Thank you!

HILARIOUS experience watching live bull riding (horrible riders who fall off in seconds but cool nonetheless), country dancing indoors, and dont want to forget the living, breathing horse roaming dead center of the outdoor bar. A night I won't forget just because I've never experienced anything like it.   I think my rating would be higher if I was into country to this extreme. It was really interesting watching people dance- twirling and dipping as they do haha

My family had a disastrous experience at Harold's across the parking lot earlier in the day at lunch. Coming back from Bartlett Lake, we were all pretty famished and wanted some good barbecue. I would say the Buffalo Chip delivered admirably. Service was fast and efficient, and they also had a rock crawling contest through the local Jeep club happening out back. This provided some fun entertainment while we waited for our food.  I would categorize their baby back ribs as good but not great. Some pieces were very tender, others were a little tough. The beans were unremarkable. I washed it all down with a very large mug of PBR at a very attractive price of $3.  The band was just setting up as we were leaving. I would've loved to stay and listen to the haggard old fella that was tuning his pedal steel guitar, but we had to get home and put the little dudes to bed. I'll make sure to come back sometime on a Saturday night to make a total ass of myself on the dance floor.  The biggest negative: This place counts itself as a Packers bar. Gross.

This is probably the worst ribeye steak I have ever had. No seasoning and really over cooked when we requested medium well. The service wasn't the best either...it wasn't busy, but it took a long time to get our food...and our server forgot to put in our order for the kids so they ended up just eating our French fries. We decided we'd just forego the additional wait and go somewhere else to eat. At least the set up was neat and the kids had a great time playing outside!

I went in this place mid afternoon and it was quiet but it sure was very clean and everyone was very friendly. I try to look for very unique places to check out. This place is for sure family friendly and all around shows how Arizonans are really all about. Family, friends, good food and some great southwestern entertainment. I will for sure be back :)

I have only been here Fridays.  Many Fridays.  The fish Fry is great, but get there early if you want a seat during tourist season.  Real deal Bull riding, real deal Cowboys and girls. It gets crazy so service can be slow at times but heck its  a real deal cowboy place.  So throw those peanut shells on the floor all you want.
This was quite an experience really good food totally awesome set up and does feel like you're back in the old west and the wait staff is nice

Happy to give a strong recommendation to this place - fun atmosphere, great service, excellent food... and really loved the made-at-the-table s'mores!  I recommend this for anyone who has out of town guests for a little bit of the 'old west' and good fun.  All you can eat BBQ on Saturday and Sunday during the day.
Fun saloon with a ton of character! Do miss out on the bbq buffet. I wasn't expecting it to taste so amazing. A great find!

Sunday Football with the Cheese heads. Not a packers fan but I went with a buddy and was truly impressed with their all you can eat BBQ. Ribs, brisket, chicken, sausage, beans, slaw, and much more. Usually go there Friday nights for some beers and fun with friends that's about it. Might have to make this a Sunday fun day and get nice n full with the mouth watering BBQ. My mouth is watering right now writing this!! Lol. Great job guys!!
Great fun outdoor bar. Bull rides on Wednesday nights that anyone can sign up for. Check it out.

Quite the cultural experience for city folk like me. My friend who lives in the area brought me here straight from the airport and thank god they serve food because I was starving. It's about $12 for a biscuit, greens, beans and a pound of meat. A POUND. Could probably have shared with a few people. I would recommend not sitting too close to the arena, the bulls kick up dirt. Cheap, strong drinks.
Friday night atmosphere is 2nd to none , food and drink sucks,  not the staffs fault .   the bar is incredible looking , get your act together
We take all our visitors to Buffalo Chip for Muttin Bustin and Bull Riding.

I enjoyed this place - I think. I was somewhat inebriated by the time we got here. I will try to remember the details... We mostly hung out on the back patio, which has it's own bar and restroom (outhouse). I mostly remember the arm wrestling machine and the drinks being really cheap... I could be wrong and just mixed this up with another bar... reading this review could be a waste of your time.

Fun Fun Fun if you like Rodeo!! I do!! I did not know I did but AH DOO :) Hee hee, very exciting..4 starts to the Cowboys and Bulls and 3 Stars for the food, 2 stars for the drinks. BBQ Real good, thang is they weigh the portions of meat, I am down with that, cept, I had a bit of fat on my plate so I wasnt too happy about paying for a a few chunks of fat , they werent small neither..and the drinks look like they came out of its a small world..better of with a standard beer, in a bottle, those portions dont change. I laughed and asked "are these child size '?  tee hee hawwww
Beer butt chicken was incredible, moist, well seasoned and overall knocked it out of the park. BUT... the pork bbq was horrible! Tasted like racoon (or what I would think racoon would taste like).
What a great experience. Went here while in town visiting family and it was SO much fun. Make sure you go on a bull riding night and having burgers and beer! Great food, prices, and so much fun

This saloon is complete fun. On a recent, hot summer weekend trip my dad actually suggested we head over here to watch the bull riding.   It is out on a main road in a nicely setup tourist/ restaurant row in Cave Creek.   We arrived around 7 pm and the parking was at capacity. We headed straight to the back outdoor area as we could hear we arrived right at show time. There's tons of seating, but it was standing room only. The scene completely exceeded my expectation. Lots of cowboy hats, boots, and smiling people.   The MC was funny, charming, and had a nice clear voice. He got the crowd excited.   The actual bull riders didn't stay on too long, but the whole show was a blast. It was just long enough to stand the heat and the dust, before the intermission came.  Time for a cold beer to refresh and to go inside to watch some phenomenal dancers, listen to a lively band, and bask in some a/c.  The decor inside enhanced the personality of this establishment. All the servers were super friendly. I felt like a regular. When I'm back in the area, I'll be kickin' some chips at the Buffalo Chip Saloon.

Really fun scene. Yea, the whole cowboy thing, but they all have so much fun you wanna go get yourself some hat & boots too!  Great live music, fun crowd. Lots of areas to hang out.  Even us city kids had a great night here!

If your looking for an Old Country type bar, look no further.......   Packed on a Friday night, 8 of us went and had their All You Can Eat Fish Special....... Nicely done without a LOT of breading, and seconds and thirds came out quickly!!!  Then top it off with Smores you make yourself at your table.....   All the fixings with a can of flaming sterno delivered to you table!!   Then you can go dance, always a live C&W band, or go watch  Just be prepared to get a bit dusty.

Go on Wedesdays or Fridays!  Its quite a hike up to Cave Creek but its worth it :)  Real bull riding and its PACKED full of people. Everyone in Cave Creek and their grandma is at Buffalo Chips.  The place itself is huge with a dance floor, restaurant area, multiple bars, arm wrestling station (hilarious), outdoor eating areas, outdoor bars, rodeo area.... and its right around a bunch of other bars within walking distance (some are very 'biker' bar'ish' so beware but try Harold's Corral next door)    The rodeo is AWESOME and they apparently have amateur night which is somewhat shocking to me... but maybe they put you on a little pony or in a full suite of armor ;)      Great western crowd... more cowboy hat and boot wearing folk than I've ever seen in one place!    In my book you are a winner if you even attempt the arm wrestling machine.... that thing is freakishly strong and makes you feel like a wimp.   Live country music is fantastic and everyone is out there dancing and swinging around! SO MUCH FUN! Dancing really is the best part of 'nightlife' in my book and I totally loved the country western dancing at Buffalo Chips.    WARNING:  DO NOT PARK ON THE STREET EVEN IF EVERYONE ELSE IS DOING IT.  Those Cave Creek patrollers are nasty and I got a whopping $200+ parking ticket as did the other 12+ cars on the street.  You've been warned yelpers!   *This is why I have to give four stars... the cruel and unusual parking ticket left a sour taste in my mouth*

So much fun. Actually going there this Friday for the bull ridiing (not to do it but to watch). Plenty of room outside and inside. It does get busy but worth the wait and plenty of other options withing this establishment to get food at another area.   Wednesday and Friday nights are the best for the bull riding. A must in my book.

Really enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was good but don't order a side of beans...not very good and weren't worth the money.  Wait staff was great and food came out quickly. Would definitely go back.

The barn is still being renovated, so everything's outside. But it was still a great time.  My friend and I arrived at 7:45pm on a Friday night, and parking was a mess. The actual parking lot is a dirt pit of sorts that was entirely filled, so it's best to just go down the road and park on the street.  They check your ID right at the entrance and give you a wristband for drinks.   It was my first rodeo show, so I was quite excited. I wore the wrong things however. Everyone had on their flannel shirts and jeans and belts with shiny buckles and cowboy boots and hats. Literally, everyone.   It's best to sit in the front seats of the ring to get the best pictures of the riders and bulls. And even if you don't purchase food or drinks, you can totally just watch the show for free. There were three rounds, but we only stayed for the first two. The first one was great bc after the cowboys ride the bulls, about 17 kids come out and ride sheep. It's so adorable.   My only complaint is that when you order and put your name in, you name is called on the speaker once your food is ready and it can be distracting during the show.   I also don't recommend getting the s'mores bc the graham crackers were soggy/stale and for $6 it's a rip-off.   The live band in between bull riding rounds is awesome. You can dance in front. There are a couple booths selling cowboy hats and boots and such.   I would totally go again and bring friends and children and whoever.

When asked if you wanna ride a bull... You say "HELL YEAH !" . My life changed after I mounted up on that beast of an animal . Granted I was only on there for 1 sec . I coulda died BRUH .. I missed out one the hot chili due to the adrenaline that was pumping through my body. Yee-haw
Great breakfast and tons of night time fun with bull riding, BBQ and even Friday nite fish fry!
I like this place. Prices are reasonable. They have really good chicken strips. Service is friendly. They teach line dancing on Sunday nights. This place is a like a home town bar with a lot of fun.

Great appetizer tacos for $2  Great fish tacos for $4 Ambiance is okay, but prefer Harolds next door. The seating area here is really tight and hard to access because the table behind is so close - and they are really long, so not easy to get in and out.  Lame rule (that the "just doing my job" type enforce) about not allowing cups to leave... even if it's water... even if you're a 3 year old kid! Ridiculous. It was 7:30 pm, and clearly none of us (who were leaving together at that time) had been drinking alcohol.  I prefer Harolds... by a long shot! The only reason we didn't go there, was because of a wedding going on, so they were closed for regular business. We are never disappointed over there. (And, we've left with to go cups of water AND tea over there before! )

I'm bumping this up even another notch. Came here tonight (wednesday) and they had LIVE bull riding. Not a mechanical bull, a REAL, LIVE BULL. Crazy. For $40, anyone can do it.  Definitely a place to take out of towners. Did I mention they have a 1 lb of food for $10 deal too? Includes your choice of a pound including biscuits, corn, beans, chicken, pork, brisket, etc

We came on a busy night, with all the cowboys and cowgirls dancing inside, and yet we were seated very quickly outside, with misters to keep us cool on the hot night.    The waitress was very attentive and never forgot about us.  She recommended the BBQ sampler and fried chicken.  Both were outrageously tasty.  We had a great time and will be back.

Cowboy haven tucked away in old town Cave Creek. Fits right into the theme of that entire stretch on Cave Creek Road. Definitely a good place to take out of towners, or to visit for a worthy filling meal.   Bbq is right on par with what you might expect from a joint in Texas.  Great ambiance both inside and out.  Woodshavings on the floor and cowboy boots suspended from the ceiling are a great  backdrop for a group photo.

Fun place!! Never fails. But beware of the police! We left an hour before closing and there were 4 cops parked right outside waiting for people. The bar was packed too, so I imagine that many will get arrested. Beware!

It's a Packer bar so how could it be bad. Well, cheese whiz on the nachos, cheese curds that even the worst place in WI wouldn't sell. And honestly could even fathom attempting another appetizer.   Atmosphere is ok. Just eat across the street first.
Decent food, good service, getting a bit old and run down. Could use a bit of a makeover.

Great place to take out-of-towners for the bull riding! I seriously miss the old Buffalo Chip building with it's dark wooden walls and back bar. The new building is beautiful and they are paying for it with increased food and drink prices! But if you are looking for a cool place to take the kids or your mother in law, this is it. On Wednesday's they have the qualifying for the rodeo. Friday night is the big show. The purse (winnings) must be some serious money because bull riders come from all over and up from Mexico. They have built more grandstand seating so you can sit all the way around the ring.  Satellite bars are conveniently placed so you can get another beverage without having to go inside every time.  It's one of the coolest places to people watch as well. You have your Creekers - the artists, Cowboys, and Indians (and their dogs), you have the folks from Scottsdale, Desert Mountain and those who make the trek up from Phoenix, all smooshed together and having a great time.  Food is ok. Smoked meat, grilled sausages, burgers. All a lot more expensive than it used to be. But a friendly staff.

My aunt and uncle love this place because the beers are huge and their dog's invited. What more could you want? One time they were there and two folks had ridden their horses right into the bar. This is their kind of place!  We sat outside on a perfect afternoon and heard stories of other Buffalo Chip visits. Nothing too crazy and never any bullriding witnessed. They said they'd never seen a fight either but this is the kind of place that just screams Roadhouse fight.   Their dog made a best friend there once but he's long gone. I could make best friends here with a tall beer and a pail of peanuts.

A very fun place for adults or family! The reason I had it 3 stars was for the food. The food is just ok but the ambiance is down right fun which makes up for the food! What place can you goto and watch real bull riding every Wed and Fri night free!!!  Live music most nights and line facing Thursday night. Go for the fun, FYI I had the ribs, wings and they were only average!!
Came here for the first time although the place is a great venue the meat was kinda dry and over cooked. That being said, I would totally come back to give it a second go

We had a absolute awesome time here. We came to enjoy Cave Creek Bike week and ended up back here each day multiple times. One of our many bartenders Brittany was fantastic. We are looking forward to our next visit thanks again Buffalo Chip!

The Buffalo Chip is a great place to drink, watch bull riding & live music, & just have fun. Food is pretty average so dont expect a whole lot when it comes to the food.   So get your drink on and saddle up partner cause only the brave will give bull riding a shot...yeehaw!!

Could not ask for a better old western bbq/saloon environment :-) Tons of old west memorabilia, great food, courteous staff and great views! Be sure to watch the bull riding out back and most importantly be sure to watch a Green Bay Packer football game here!! Old history of the bar was once owned by ex Green Bay Packer great Max McGee! All around A+

This barn/country saloon looks fantastic and the help loves to help... my only complaint is the price of the drinks... my 22 oz import draft was 7 bucks, and my gf's drink was 11 dollars.. and it was 10% off Monday's...  otherwise the experience was great and they play good country music...

The original Cave Creek cowboy bar.  How can anyone argue with live bull riding?  Do yourself a favor though, eat before you go.  The food isn't bad, but I just kind of think its for the tourists.  The Pat James Band plays most nights and is incredibly good to have remained a house band all these years.  Go after 9pm, order something on the rocks and have fun.

We will return.  Here on a Wednesday night awaiting the bull rides. Numerous beers on tap.  We walked up to the bar to get our own drinks and we went out to the seats to watch the amateur bull riders.  There were little fires throughout the area to warm you on a cool night.  You can make reservations to sit in their "skybox" for a $10 fee per person to watch the bull riding.  Or just sit in the stands for free.
